results.description:
The Mobile Apps Roulette meetup is for interactive iOS/Android demos with full audience participation.  Instead of just watching demos then asking questions, we the audience use each app as it's being presented.

Many mobile apps today have a social and/or location component and so having a group of people using them at the same time provides a valuable use case for the apps' developers and interesting audience interactions.

At the beginning of each meetup, all attendees download the apps that'll be presented in the meetup (open wifi provided).

By using the apps during the demos rather than just watching, attendees can give better feedback and the demos are more fun because presenters tailor them for audience participation.

Our meetups are held at Space-4-Work in Greenwich Village.

Pizza and sodas provided.

 

----

If you are interested in presenting your iOS or Android app, contact the meetup's organizer.
results.name: Mobile Apps Roulette

results.description:
Imagine…

Hundreds of New Yorkers coming together in small groups of neighbors

and fellow citizens to discuss topics of intensive interest…

Hosted at no cost and at convenient locations and times…

Aided by simple guiding principles…

Inspired by the city’s grand tradition of robust conversation…


Our vision is to inspire, organize, publicize, facilitate and celebrate a renaissance of healthy dialogue in New York City.

Our Mission:

1. Encourage and support interesting and important conversations among New Yorkers at the grass-roots level,

2. Establish simple, affordable, and sustainable infrastructure to foster such conversations throughout the city year-round.

3. Add to the worldwide image of New York as a metropolis where culture and intellect thrive among the people.

4. Organize the plethora of conversations happening in the city and have them listed in one central and easily-accessible spot.

5. Maintain conversations with a human face by discussing topics in-person, while also allowing for further discussion online.

Note:  For access to all CNY-sponsored events, go to http://www.conversationsnewyork.com and subscribe to our blog,

and "Like" our Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/conversationsnewyor....
results.name: "Conversations New York"

results.description: Join us and learn the art of soapmaking, working with herbs, aromatherapy and starting your own small business in this field. Courses in a wide variety of programs, including beginner and advanced soap classes, body butters, natural shampoos and haircare products, bootcamp intensives, entrepreneur workshops and more. Come network with us!
results.name: New York City Natural Soap & Beauty Products

results.description:
The Age of Enlightenment was one of the most important periods in the history of thought. It gave birth not only to deists and freethinkers, but also to democratic ideals and the scientific method.

Perhaps most important was David Hume's idea that mankind's next project as a civilization should be to found a "science of human nature" -- a body of concepts that would help us distinguish between the fixed characteristics of human nature and those flexible dimensions in which individuals develop unique qualities. If we had such a science, we could stop fighting our nature and focus on developing those assets our nature is designed to acquire -- things like truth and right, knowledge and ability, insights and skills.

Come join a small group of men and women who meet every month in Manhattan to discuss books and other media that relate broadly to themes of intellectual liberation and social progress, and more specifically to the question "Who are we and what are we capable of?"

In addition to books, we'll read shorter works like essays, speeches, and anthologies split up into two or more sessions, a well as works that our members have written.  Although you don't have to be an expert on the topic we're focusing on before visiting, if you don't have anything to contribute then please just listen. Questions about our policies or history should be raised before or after the group but not during it. And if you haven't done the reading let the discussion be led by those who have.

Your hosts are Dean Hannotte and Rachel Bartlett and our website is The Enlightenment Book Club.
results.name: The Enlightenment Book Club

topics.name: The Open Web Application Security Project

results.description:
Women's Society of Cyberjutsu is a 501c3 organization whose mission is to advance women in Cybersecurity.

Membership is comprised of Women either in the Information Security field or wanting to enter the field. We provide training (workshops, study groups, classes, mentoring, networking, internship/job placement assistance & resource-sharing, and opportunities.

We use meetup.com as an event notification platform and also use a mailing list to foster communication between members. You'll want to become a member via the website to take advantage of all the benefits! Membership options are: Full, Student/Military, Free and Associate (for our male friends).

New and seasoned professionals are encouraged to join. Our hashtag is #womenscyberjutsu

Topics covered:

Penetration Testing, Exploitation, Password Cracking, Buffer Overflows, Shellcode, Vulnerability Assessment, Rootkits, Website/Web App Testing – XSS, CSRF, SQL Injection, Browser Exploitation,   Information Assurance, OSINT, Certification & Accreditation – DIACAP, NIST, Tools of the trade – Metasploit, Nessus, Nmap, Burp Suite, Wireshark, Malware Analysis,  Certification Study – CISSP, CEH, ECSA, Security+, Digital Forensics, Auditing, Reverse Engineering, Risk Assessments, Computer & Network Forensics, Wireless, Network Analysis, Social Engineering, Cryptography, VOIP, Architecture Standards, Incident response, Compliance & Governance, Business Continuity, SCADA, Disaster Recovery, Mobile
results.name: Women in Cybersecurity - Information Security - NY

results.description:
I am an ordained High Priestess and In this group we talk about what it is like to be a pagan parent, problems, issues, homeschooling, crafts, and events happening on Long Island in Nassau County NY and surrounding Counties. This group is open to anyone with an open mind of course and all earth based religions. People from other locations will still find interest in this group, but to meet up with would be a challenge! I would like to start meeting up at the local venues where here in Nassau County! My local library is RVC public library, and another few venues where we can meet up are local parks, Dinners, and Bars for adult only nights. Of course we are always going to expand the venues as more meet ups are scheduled! So far we meet up once a month for individuals and or their families to come on the last Saturday of every month at the Baldwin Coach Dinner located in Baldwin on Sunrise Hwy, across from the Baldwin Train Station. Eventually I would like to make those meet ups twice a month so we can discuss possible fund raisers to light of our pockets so we can plan trips and activities. As of right now we meet once a month and come together to discuss topics of interest, problems that might be affecting you or others in the community, and sort of community service that we could suggest, and or activities, as well as future events and meetings. I would like to start children's book readings again which we will start out as once every other week and depending on the outcome we will either make it once a month or or even better would be every week! Of course with that in mind for children I would like to start arts and crafts again now that the holidays are nearing and there are many things we can plan so they can have fun! Oh excuse me I almost forgot that I wanted to inform everyone how I created a scouting group meetup page and for who are interested for further information please go to http://www.meetup.com/AllMotherEarthsChildr.... Please feel free to Contact me for further information!

Blessed Be, High Priestess Jeanann
results.name: Nassau County Witches

We are going to touch the stars, travel through time, eat tasty and decadent delights, learn to fly, laugh til we cry, and much more! results.description:
Hack Manhattan is located on 137 West 14th Street between Union Square and Chelsea. We are dedicated to technology, art and craft. Our physical space is open every Tuesday and Thursday evening. A smaller 3D printing foucsed group gathers on Thursday evenings, and it’s possible to visit the space and use our facilities at other times whenever a member is hosting.

A lot of our activities have focused on electronics and 3D printing, but we also have a machine shop with a lathe and a mill, sewing machines, gardening and even a beehive on the roof.

Tech Tuesday is the weekly open night at Hack Manhattan, a community hackerspace in the Union Square neighborhood of Manhattan. Stop by to chat about your projects and use our electronics tools, 3D printers, sewing machines or machine shop. Everyone is encouraged to bring a project to work on!

Most of the community activity happens on Blabber, our discussion mailing list.

We're the guys out and about all over the city making our films. Founded by a production company in New York with tithes to some big names in entertainment, its our goal to do one thing and one thing only...make films. Just a few examples of our works to come: private film screenings, script readings, film premieres, film shoots (shorts and features) and not to mention getting to know one another on a close personal level. Want to join us?

results.description:
Does it seem that our modern society has fallen out of step with our long held traditions and social mores? The Center for the Restoration of Ma'at seeks to reconnect us with the ancient wisdom of Egypt (Kemet). Activities include monthly museum tours, college-level courses (in-person and online), lectures/workshops, and annual study tours to Egypt and other international locations. The Center also produces the weekly television show, Kemetic Legacy Today.

The Center is directed by Jabari Osaze. Brother Osaze has been studying Ancient Egypt for 25 years, and has led annual tours in Egypt since 2002. He is also a Kemetic priest and is currently establishing the Shrine of Ma'at.
results.name: Ancient Egyptian (Kemet) Awakening

results.description: A3E is a Business-to-Business Exchange Dedicated to the Exploration of New Technologies & Apps that are Transforming the Music Industry and the Creative Process of Musicians & Audio Professionals. The interaction and symbiotic relationship between these three ecosystems is where the paradigm shifts, the new applications and the new business models are and will be emerging from. A3E is at the core of these universes and A3E’s mission is to facilitate and create an Exchange of information, data, technologies and relationships that will help all these individuals and organizations build the best products, create the best music and content, as well as drive the most profitable businesses possible.

results.description:
Manhattan is our paradise garden with ample photographic opportunities. This group is for amateur photographers who would like to improve their skills through practice and sustained self education. Why do some photographs work while some do not? How should we correctly expose a photograph? I am an amateur myself, and do not know all the answers. However, much of the enjoyment of photography is the thinking process that goes on before the shutter is clicked. We will read books, practice and most importantly teach each other as we learn. And Manhattan in all its variety will be our playground.

My intent is to put together a group of regulars, and together we will be set ourselves on a path of self education in photography. This group is for you if (a) you have the dedication and time to devote to photography, (b) have a digital camera with manual settings, (c) open to constructive criticism of your work. The current plan is:

  • One meeting will be to discuss composition. I have chosen Michael Freeman's series: The Photographer's Eye. We will discuss one chapter, and take/share photographs illustrating the materials.
  • The second meeting will be to discuss exposure. This is much easier to learn, so in the future we will probably have a combination of other digital or technical issues like Lightroom.
  • I'd also like to put together informal photowalks over some weekends to actually go out and practice what we learn. These plans will evolve as we come together as a group.

So if you are a dedicated amateur with the time to devote and looking for similar minded people,welcome and see you all at the next meeting.
results.name: A Walk in Paradise Garden

results.description: NYC Algorithmic Trading is for anyone interested in creating and using algorithms in the financial markets. We arrange monthly talks from practicing quants, algorithmic traders, trading technology experts, and academics. Our focus is practical, rather than theoretical. We enjoy talking about how to automate the purchase and sale of securities using statistics, machine learning, data mining, and algorithms.

This is a great time of life -  we have experienced a lot and know that there is a lot more to come. And New York is such a great place to do it all the boroughs have so much to see and experience. This meetup group's purpose is to brainstorm how to overcome these challenges, and many of our activities will be focused on exposing educators to ideas and products developed to help them inside and outside of the classroom.  We believe no person is an island so let's get out there and see what the tech world has for Educators and what Educators can do for the tech world, and for one another.

The location will change - probably with every meet up - so that we can use these opportunities to give exposure to all of the interesting and accessible venues available.

results.description:
The FinTech Hackathon | www.fintechhack.com

The goal of the FinTech Hackathon is to promote the development of financial technology for institutional customers and consumers.

The Hackathon brings together FinTech developers and designers to develop financial products and discover new technologies. Example applications include innovations in risk management, trading, big data, retail banking, regulatory compliance, mobile payments and enterprise social.

APIs and platforms from technology partners will be made available during the Hackathon. Attendees will spend 24 hours coding, validating their ideas, networking and then demoing their hacks to a panel of FinTech VCs, executives and entrepreneurs.

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in research concerning artificial neural networks, deep learning, and so on. The format varies between discussion groups, guest speakers, and tutorials. Proposed topics include: training deep belief networks with unsupervised pre-training/supervised finetuning, recurrent neural networks, different optimization methods, scalable architectures for large networks across clusters, practical GPU programming (with Python!), NNs for NLP, using NNs in robotics, visualizations to monitor NN learning, and other stuff specific to these areas of research. Recent developments in this area of research show a lot of promise, but very few people within the machine learning community have any practical experience with these methods. Since there's so few of us, we should get together and share notes!
results.name: NYC Neural Network Aficionados Discussion Group

results.description: This group is for women interested in Sci-Fi and Fantasy movies , books , events and discussions. I started the group to meet other cool women who share some of these interests. We will meet once a month to discuss our great reads or more often depending on fun events that come up in between. results.description: The NCC Group Open Forum is an informal and open venue for the discussion and presentation of security related research and tools, and an opportunity for security researchers from all fields to get together and share work and ideas. Open Forum meets quarterly in the Bay Area, Seattle, Austin, Chicago, and New York City. Forum agendas are crafted with the specific needs/interests of its members in mind and consist of brief 30 minute talks. Talks are not product pitches or strongly vendor preferential. Attendance is by invite only. Any area of security is welcome including reversing, secure development, new techniques or tools, application security, cryptography, etc.
results.name: NCC Group Security Open Forum - New York City

results.description:
Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

 

Student Testimonial:

"From the very moment that I met Nan , I knew that she was going to be someone very special to me! I met her at the Navel expo in November 2012. I had been looking for someone to teach me to meditate at that time, and the moment I joined her and a small group of people at the expo, i immediately began to feel the energy and power of Nan...I could see all the colors of  my chakras, like a light show inside of me,and felt  intense energy that was what i would describe as healing love. She is truly an amazing and gifted soul !!!"" Bonnie, Bodhi Meditation @ the Navel Expo November 2012

 

How can I expect to benefit from Bodhi Meditation?

Meditation has been used successfully in conjunction with conventional medical treatments.

In the Western medical world, it has already been applied to treat the following:

1. Addiction-related issues, ranging from behavior awareness to withdrawal symptom management for narcotics, nicotine, and alcohol dependencies

2. Cancer-related issues

3. High blood pressure: a report from the National Institutes of Health (NIH) recommends meditation as one of the primary treatments for high blood pressure

4. HIV-related issues

5. Menopausal symptoms

6. Pain issues and responses

7. Stress, anxiety and depression

The practice of Bodhi methods benefits both the body and the mind.

Physical benefits of Bodhi Meditation may include:

1. The regulation of arterial and nervous system disease (e.g., fatigue, headaches, insomnia, nervous breakdown, etc.)

2. Amelioration of lower back and spinal pain, numbness of the extremities, rheumatism and neurovascular illness

3. Improvement of liver, gallbladder, spleen, stomach and kidney function, as well as relief from diseases of the internal organs

4. Treatment of allergies

5. Notable improvements in overall physical condition and general appearance, including weight control

6. The clearing of mental distractions and impurities, facilitating the emergence of seemingly inexplicable abilities

7. The occurrence of a state in which, without intending so, a practitioner becomes unable or unwilling to eat, yet is relaxed and full of energy – it is known as "spontaneous fasting"

The psychological and spiritual benefits of Bodhi Meditation may include:

1. Increased patience and willpower

2. Increased mental agility and task proficiency

3. An improved ability to remain calm and emotionally grounded

4. A broader, more open heart, increased initiative and enthusiasm, plus greater motivation to help others

*********

If you can open your heart and relax your mind you will find this form of meditation beneficial to your health and spiritual well being.

 

Student testimonial:

"I have tried many different forms of meditation and yoga over the years. Though I have experienced some positive changes practicing over the years I never felt committed to practice on regular basis. Nan takes it to a whole other level. How and why? All I can say is you have to experience it for yourself. There is power in simplicity,love, and truth. Despite some language barriers(which are minor) You can feel her love and healing energy. Open your mind and see with a different set of eyes. I highly recommend her special Saturday classes." Michelina (Bodhi Meditation class Saturday November 15, 2014)

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe (Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014)

"Nan was quite the leader. She was funny, informative, and most of all, good at what she does. The class was well attended. I'd say there were 70 persons in the large room. The entire event ran from 6:45 to 8:40, nearly two hours. It didn't seem too long since about half of that time, our eyes were shut!" Alex (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Tuesday November 12, 2013)

"I was at Nan's Tuesday meditation meeting--the energy is wonderful! I came in with stomach pain which was almost completely gone after a few minutes of the meditation. Wonderful feelings of oneness and connection!" Pam (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Tuesday October 22, 2013)

"It was enlightening!!! Every time I practice Bodhi meditation, it feels like my Chi increases more and more! Thank you everyone for sharing this to NYC." Javoski (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Friday September 13, 2013)

"Nan emits healing energy -- the meditation is wonderful" Linda (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Friday September 13, 2013)

"Very calming and energizing. I did not have any negative thoughts or worries last night in bed like I always do. I felt my mind was clear. I will definitely go to another class" Dee (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Friday September 13, 2013)

"I Walked In With Lower Back Pain, Listened, Opened My Heart And Relaxed My Mind And Walked Out Feeling Better Than I Have In Almost Two Weeks. Thank You So Much. Looking Forward To Friday's " Ed (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Tuesday July 30, 2013)

"It was an amazing experience, Nan, you are truly a master. Can't wait to check out more of your classes!" Dan (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Tuesday July 23, 2013)
results.name: Bodhi Meditation with Nan - Join with an open heart.

The Hoboken Cove Boathouse is a non-profit public boathouse for the community of Hoboken and surrounding areas. We are a dedicated group of volunteers. Many of us are experienced kayakers and enjoy sharing our love of the Hudson river. See you on the Hudson soon! Jon and Eileen

topics.name: Photo Restoration & Retouching with Photoshop CS5

results.description: This group is specifically for professionals in the digital retouching industry, who are in the NYC area (Manhattan and outer boroughs). All levels are welcome, from senior retouchers/managers to junior retouchers just starting out. The goal of this initiative is to develop a community of serious individuals who are passionate about Photoshop retouching, who can guide one another through the industry. Ideally, we would be able to network, provide mentoring, and share our experiences. Please be aware that if retouching is only a PART of what you do (that is, if you are a photographer who retouches their own work, for example), this is not the right group for you. Similarly, this group is not intended for hobbyists or those with only a cursory or casual interest in Photoshop. Finally, please note that if you solely work in Photoshop to restore old photos, for the purposes of this group, you would be considered to work in Restoration, and NOT retouching.
results.name: New York City Professional Digital Retouchers

MOCHA is a group for parents of children with autism or related developmental disorders. We get together and share experiences, resources and have fun!

We are an outlet for parents in need of support, want to have play-dates and share experiences. We focus not only on support, but self-advocacy. We work to educate our members through parents experiences in working with the many systems in place to help our children.

If you are interested in family-fun, moms night outs and learning more about autism and PDD-NOS then this group is for you! Dads are welcome too. Please like our Facebook page below.

https://www.facebook.com/MomsOfChildrenWhoHaveAutism?ref=hl

results.description: Twitter New York welcomes software engineers and technologists who are interested in learning about our engineering projects and initiatives. While we have made great progress, there are lots of massive technical challenges to solve. With millions of  active users on Twitter, we're always working on ways to scale our products and play with massive amounts of realtime data. Our New York based engineering teams own the Discover tab, working on new approaches to search quality and building highly scalable distributed systems. We're also building geo location services. Please join this group if you're interested in staying up to date on the latest tech talks and events hosted by Twitter NYC's engineering team. Our talks will feature some of our subject matter experts in the areas of machine learning, search and relevance, geo, platform services and infrastructure.

QlikView is a new kind of Business Intelligence software and has experienced tremendous growth over the years. Goal of this group is to share best practices, promote QlikView and provide an opportunity to meet others in the QlikView world.

Join us if you are interested in:
* Discovering the QlikView Business Discovery platform
* Discovering how QlikView can help you to better understand your business: Finance, HR, IT, Marketing, Sales, Supply chain, Web, etc.
* Discovering how QlikView could help you to realize the full potential of your database: SAP, Oracle, Lawson/Movex, JD Edwards, Informatica, Hyperion, Quickbooks, Salesforce, Social Media (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, etc.) and much more!
* Sharing QlikView technical’s Best Practices, Tips and Tricks!
results.name: QlikView - Next Generation BI - New York

results.description:
If you are interested in expanding your community and social support network, to develop new friendships, and plan interesting and fun activities; Then please join our  Long Island Professional Women's Social Network 50+.

Membership will be limited in size so we can enjoy the opportunity to share each others experience, humor, knowledge and personal talents. Neighboring community members   are also welcome.

Annual membership dues will be $6 for 2015 payable 12 months from your latest payment.

(Please note: we welcome optimistic, positive, giving and supportive members with creative ideas to share and enrich our special group.)

If this sounds like your kind of group please share your specific interests so we can all plan and schedule our meet-ups.

Please note-Click RSVP button to confirm or edit to change your RSVP if you need to cancel.

Waiver:The organizer(s) of this Meet- up schedules various venues and activities based on members expressed interests. Your participation acknowledges your acceptance  with this waiver  that attendance is voluntary and the organizer(s) provide no guarantee, responsibility or liability related to your participation, (satisfaction, injury otherwise.) Thank you.

Looking to develop speaking and leadership skills? Ace a job interview? Ignite your career? Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Our membership is 280,000 strong. Our members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending one of the 13,500 clubs like Manhattan Toastmasters Club Membership in Manhattan

Toastmasters is one of the greatest investments you can make in yourself. At Manhattan Toastmasters we provide a safe environment to overcome fear, try new speaking tactics, or practice that upcoming sales presentation. At $48 every six months, it is also one of the most cost-effective skill-building tools available anywhere.

Visit our website

Complete list of group rules

The club's tumblr blog

See changes to the guest policy in the full About page

Visiting Guests, as well as members from other Toastmaster Clubs are welcome to attend any general meeting provided there is space available. Other Toastmaster Club members who would like to be a guest speaker only need to reach out to schedule a slot for the presentation.

We encourage guests to seriously consider membership in our Club. A guest is allowed to visit two (2) meetings, at which point we will ask you to fill out an application for membership at the end of the third meeting.

You want to grow, excel, and be the best speaker on the block. Come join Manhattan Toastmasters.

Looking for a NYC Area Titanium Consultant/Professional? Want to be added to the list?

Titanium Help Wanted Postings. Want to add a posting?
results.name: NYC Titanium Users Group

results.description:
Isn't it time for apps and devices to adapt to us?

HUI™or Humanizeded User Interface™ is a set of technologies that enable apps and devices to communicate with humans the way that humans communicate with one another. For example, voice, gesture, facial recognition, emotional interpretation, gaze tracking, haptics and other interface modalities, as well as “back-end” technologies such as cognitive computing and artificial intelligence.

Every major tech company including Google, Apple, Intel, Microsoft, IBM, Facebook, and Amazon are heavily invested in HUI technology. They know that to make their products and applications more powerful, usable, appealing, and financially successful, HUI is a requirement.

This is the community of those tech rock stars that are developing HUI, as well as enthusiasts that delight in using and learning about these cutting edge technologies.

If you're building apps or products, got a start-up or idea, want to share your skills and knowledge or learn from others, want to get in on tech's new leading edge, or are just a techno geek, this is the group for you!

Events include: speakers, hackathons, meet & greets, project showcases, and more.

Join us now to experience new stuff, learn something, meet like-minded people, and have fun.

And in case you're wondering... HUI Central is the largest HUI (or NUI) group in the world!

Keywords: Kinect, RealSense, Siri, Google Voice, Watson, IoT, apps, games, devices

Humanized User Interface, HUI, and HUI Central are trademarks of ScreenPlay InterActive Corp.
results.name: HUI Central - NY

results.description: Buskers are aspiring musicians who perform live on the sidewalk, underground in a train station, or Central Park for free. Their musical styles range from acoustic to classical to folk and more. I was surprised to find there was not a single meetup dedicated to these adventurous musicians who play all over the world, so I thought I would create one. I have no idea where this will go. Perhaps we will find out where they play in advance and help build a fan base, or maybe we will find a venue and bring some musical talent together in NYC. I do not support panhandling or playing in subway trains, which can be distracting to a captive audience and sometimes dangerous. Please, let's keep it safe.
results.name: Buskers Worldwide

results.description:
This is the group for movies so bad they're good.

Does a one star Netflix rating intrigue you? Would you watch Jesus Christ Vampire Hunter simply because a movie with that title must be awesome? Does your list of cinematic classics include things like Barbarella, Zardoz, and Mega Shark vs. Giant Octopus?

More importantly, do you want to get together with a room full of people who just said "yes Yes YES" to the above, and spend hours making fun of horrible movies and laughing your ass off?

Meetups are in Astoria (Queens), one block from the 30th ave NQ stop.

Note that you must be THIS depraved to enter - I moderate signups to exclude/protect people who only think they like bad movies because they've never truly seen one.

(Group policies are listed in the Discussion tab)

results.description:
Welcome to the New York NetSuite Meet-up – by Hara Partners.

We created this meet-up in the hopes that we could develop a strong and dynamic NetSuite community with members from across the NetSuite spectrum. From industry executives to business owners reliant on the software and from coders and developers to NetSuite employees we feel that everyone brings a unique perspective and set of experiences to the table and together we can be greater than each individual.

The meet-up takes place on the second Wednesday of each month at Hara Partners' Midtown offices (locate us on Google Maps) and is the perfect way to stay abreast of the latest NetSuite developments and trade gossip and to foster relationships within the industry. Each meet-up, hosted by Hara Partners resident e-Commerce and NetSuite experts, features an in-depth look at a facet of NetSuite, often hosted by a guest expert form the field, and a meet-and-greet period during which members are encouraged to give an elevator pitch to introduce themselves and their business.

At Hara Partners we expect our members to be vocal: please use the message boards! (http://netsuite-meetup.harapartners.com/messages/boards/) We want to know what your experience has been with NetSuite, both as developers and users:  What did you enjoy; what problems did you face and how did you maximize NetSuite's potential for your business needs. We are particularly proud of our NetSuite-Magento Connector (http://www.harapartners.com/netsuite-magento-connector).

Members are encouraged to suggest any partnerships and sponsorships for the New York NetSuite Meet-up Group as well as request future topics.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meet-up to get our NetSuite ideas flowing!

The Hara Partners Team - “Focus on what you do best”.

http://www.harapartners.com

No recruitment or advertising of any kind is allowed on this site; Hara Partners reserves the right to accept/ban any members at our discretion.
results.name: New York NetSuite Meetup - NY Group - by harapartners.com

This group provides  an atmosphere where women could laugh socialize

results.description:
Wouldn't you like to know who you're looking at?

Now you can -  by becoming a face reader.

Facial Analytics will improve your personal and professional relationships and give you real insight into a person's character, personality traits, strengths and weaknesses.

Facial Analytics can help you in every aspect of your life. In relationships and love, it can help you to identify your soul mate. In the workplace as an employer, to find the best person for the job and as a parent or child, to understand those family dynamics that frustrate and infuriate us all.

Talk about turning the odds in your favor. Come learn the ancient science of face reading, develop the tools to discover your soul mate, and meet others on the same journey.

 

What are the benefits to learning Facial Analytics?

Three components make up the basic process.

First - the attempt to understand who this individual in front of you is? What are they about? How can you as a teacher, leader, or healer best serve them?

Secondly - the process of learning to read faces has the effect of opening the heart energy. This increases our capacity for practicing compassionate comprehension. The magic of reading faces is that it can generate deep, empathic reasoning, and this makes it possible to contain the person deeply, ie. to contain their whole being in the space of your heart. It is truly an extraordinary thing to learn and teach others this ability to understand someone deeply and completely, free of our usual habit of trying to fit someone into a preconceived box.

The third thing that occurs when you learn to face read in this deeply empathic manner, is that you become healed yourself. You begin to understand that your experiences are shared, we are all sharing in the frailties and foibles of life with everyone around us. You will feel less alone, and perhaps more importantly, realize that we are all innocent victims of our environmental conditions. You will realize that even your parents who may have disappointed you (or worse), and even those who have hurt you, are innocent victims of the conditions of their environment.

While this does not mean that we will externally condone dysfunctional behavior, it will make it easier to internally forgive it.

 

About Atma, your Facial Analytics instructor.

Atma has been studying this emerging science of face reading for 13 years. In 2005, after six years of apprenticeship, he was given permission by Dr. Lincoln to teach and train others.

As an expert in Facial Analytics, Atma's methodology derives from combining his studies of ancient Vedic sciences and Western psychology.

With wisdom and insight gained from decades of academic research, rigorous and austere spiritual practice and real world business experience, Atma will guide you through the unlimited applications of face reading in one's personal and professional life and in the service of others.

Prepare for a heart opening journey that will explore the full gamut of human compassion and empathy and the absolute need for personal discipline and courage.

 

Get a face reading at howtoreadfaces.com
results.name: Facial Analytics - NY

results.description:
Who should join us ?

Singles from the US, Europe, Africa, Asia, Oceania interested to meet other singles in New York City, and being interested in meeting people from various countries, religions, ethnics and cultures.

Our group is opened to any sexual orientation, yet restricted to open-minded and fun people of all ages, and with one thematic event per week/month, suggested by members and/or organizers.

 

Why should you join ?

You should join us if you are single and interested in cultural diversity. You will have opportunities to learn from others, to challenge yourself, have fun, hopefully you will find the right special someone. Our members mingle, but they also make true friends, as members having found their soul mate through us are more than welcome to stay and share this experience.

Our members are singles and elite, but most importantly, they are unique, that's the thing that matters the most in everyone's quest for love. What can you expect out of our group ? Our typical activities will be going out together, meet, mingle, and learn from each others. We like the concept of speed dating but we think a "slow dating" event is even better, themed parties, watching movies, going together to museums exhibition and tours with curators.

 

What we are NOT and we do NOT do :

We respect individuals (you) as well as Meetup group's community guidelines. In particular :

● We don't primarily promote a product, business, venue or service

● We don't divert members to another website and we don't act as a lead generator for another website

● We never send spam and we don't primarily broadcast messages rather than have events

● We don't create this group to promote a one-time event, we intend to have several events together

 

Jean-Philippe, Yara, and Rena

results.description:
Welcome to CrossConnection North Jersey, a church plant in the form of a Bible study serving northeast New Jersey! We are a little over one year into our church plant as we continue to build our core team. So what does that mean? Through God’s grace, we’re building the core of the church one person at a time with the goal of launching a Sunday service once we reach critical mass.

The whole of our mission could be summarized into three elements:

- Love God.
- Love Each Other.
- Make Disciples.

All that Jesus told the church to be and do is summarized in those three statements and therefore, that is our goal too. Our model for church growth is found in the Scriptures in Acts 2:42: “And they continued steadfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and in prayers.” As such, we dedicate our time to the studying of the scriptures through our weekly Bible study and seek opportunities to gather in fellowship throughout the week for prayer.

If you’re in Bergen County and you’re looking for a church, or are interested in a grass-roots church plant movement, or simply have a pioneering spirit in the things of God, we invite you to come out and be a part of what God is doing through this church plant!

For more information please visit www.crossconnectionnj.org.

Blessings,

Jay
results.name: Cross Connection North Jersey

Rising Tides Alliance, based in Westchester County, NY, is a networking organization that believes networking should be more than handing out a business card. We are givers in the true sense. The true giver knows that giving is the tide that raises all ships, that it allows you to be a person of value to others while doing very well for yourself.

 

MISSION

Our mission at Rising Tides Alliance is to provide a professional and comfortable environment for business owners, entrepreneurs and business professionals to network while supporting charitable children's causes throughout the community, enlisting the values of relationships, charity and prosperity.

VISION

A networking group dedicated to the expansion of each members business through the power of referral. We collectively create business opportunities for each other as trusted professionals while sharing ideas to build relationships and help each of our members succeed.

PURPOSE

Our purpose to enhance relationships, build strategic alliances and support networking opportunities amongst our member businesses. Our intention is for the membership to share knowledge, provide introductions, and recommend and refer each other. We strongly believe that through these efforts we can make a substantial difference in the lives of our members as well as our community.

GOAL

Our goal is to help drive your business by providing opportunities to enhance their unique strengths. This is achieved by sharing their business experiences and knowledge through regular meetings, a strong network of professional contacts, educational opportunities, and ongoing support. We are dedicated to bringing people together to form a profitable network through increasing our relationships and helping charities.

results.description:
How does one live a good life?

This simple question can be surprisingly difficult to answer. Yet not taking an honest try at answering it (or even worse: ignoring the question entirely) can lead to the risk of misliving one's life. One of the main goals of ancient philosophy in the West was to help guide people in answering this question rigorously and well, and then helping people to live in accordance with their life's philosophy (literally "the love of wisdom").

One of the most successful and influential schools of thought in the ancient world which addressed this question was Stoicism. Stoicism taught that by cultivating personal excellence ('arete' in Greek) was all that was needed to lead a good life and flourish as a human being ('eudaimonia' in ancient Greek). To do this, the ancient Stoics taught a host of practices and a sophisticated theory of mind to help the Stoic student on the path to eudaimonia. Stoic philosophy had a huge influence on the West, from helping shape early Christianity to being a strong influence on the modern psychological movement of cognitive-behavioral therapy.

But Stoic philosophy is not only useful for those in the ancient world. For instance, James Stockdale has cited Stoic philosophy as helping him cope with the horrors of being a prisoner of war in Vietnam. Also, the University of Exeter in the UK has conducting pilot studies starting in 2012 of the effect of Stoic practices on various measures psychological well-being with promising preliminary results. Stoicism can be of great use to people in our modern era.

The goal of this meetup is to introduce Stoic philosophy as a way of life to people interested in living a more meaningful, tranquil life and to support experienced students of Stoic philosophy in their practice. While many of the meetups will be focused around reading, this is not a group for disengaged study of ancient philosophy from an academic perspective. Instead, this is a group for helping people to put Stoic philosophy into practice in their daily lives, so they can live the best life they can.

Are you ready to attempt to live a more tranquil, meaningful, and happy life? Then join us today!
results.name: New York City Stoics

We are creating a vast mastermind network so we are able to help educate, promote and lift up all those around us on a grand scale.  This also enables us to bring more value to our members by putting them in contact with unlimited resources, including expanding education and industry contacts.

If you are interested in learning about real estate investing and how to take what you are currently doing to the next level, come join us on our journey. No experience? No problem. We can show you how to get started. Experienced Vet with knowledge to share? We welcome you too! We’re about making investors be the best they can be. We provide investors with a built in safety, by connecting with USA Rehab Deals, we essentially put your eyes in any market. Think you don’t have time or too busy to do it yourself? Spend one hour a month with us so you don’t have to spend 40 hours a week on you own.

“Don't wait until everything is just right. It will never be perfect. There will always be challenges, obstacles and less than perfect conditions. So what. Get started now. With each step you take, you will grow stronger and stronger, more and more skilled, more and more self-confident and more and more successful.” – Mark Victor Hansen

results.description:
Hello everyone and welcome!

A SOUND JOURNEY group meditation lasts between 60 and 90 minutes.

We begin with a guided yoga nidra meditation, which is followed by the Sound Journey itself. Then we finish with some integrative silence. At the end, I invite participants to share their experience to the group if they feel inspired to do so.

I use Didjeridoos, Tibetan Singing Bowls, Crystal Bowls, Keyboard, Percussion, and my voice.

For the entire experience, you lie down (or sit if you prefer) in deep relaxation and experience sounds' soothing vibrations, energizing presence, and healing power.

Although the structure remains the same, every session can vary greatly in content, length, and intensity.

I hope to see you soon!

Peace, 

Vincent 

p.s. I also offer private sessions.

p.p.s. With my wife, Kristin, we have another meetup,

http://www.meetup.com/Sound-and-Silence-Meditation/

topics.name: Indigenous Wisdom with authentic elders and shaman

results.description:
Kinding Sindaw (www.kindingsindaw.org) is a cultural performance troupe that has been in existence for over 20 years and is currently a resident artist group at La Mama E.T.C. Our mission is to educate and enlighten communities about the complex history and cultures of the indigenous peoples of the Philippines. Through the use of an artistic medium, which preserves the cultural heritage of the indigenous peoples from these regions, we seek to explore universal issues of the value of oral history, power, gender relations and environmental degradation that resonate with the current struggles of these indigenous peoples, but which also are shared concerns throughout the world. Since its founding, Kinding Sindaw has actively performed and provided cultural workshops and educational programs at venues throughout the city. These include full-scale dance-dramas: "Irimun o Banag", "Agama Niyog", "Rajah Mangandiri", "Lemlunay", "Sultan Kudarat", and "Bembaran". Venues have included La Mama ETC, Lincoln Center, The Puffin Room, Riverside Church, Mulberry Street Theatre, Wave Hill and NY area colleges. Additionally, we provide storytelling workshops at NYC area colleges, libraries (Jackson Heights Community Library) and museums (Met, Museum of Natural History, Asia Society). By presenting the rich and varied complexity of the indigenous peoples of the Philippines, we have been able to work with a variety of different community organizations and groups, and serve as a resource to help educate youth and adults.

In addition to existing workshops, Kinding Sindaw seeks to deepen and enrich the participant’s knowledge about Philippine history and culture, through a series of immersive arts and cultural workshops, led by Potri Ranka Manis, the founder and executive director of Kinding Sindaw. These workshops and classes will interweave the teaching of music, dance and martial arts movements with the history and struggles of the different indigenous tribes of the Philippines. Consequently, through this deep and active engagement, the participant will discover the tremendous significance of preserving the indigenous arts, culture, traditions and history of the Philippines, while becoming a tradition-bearer herself, capable of educating future generations and asserting her rightful place in our modern society.
results.name: Kinding Sindaw Cultural and Arts Educational Workshops

Hackers + Designers + Entrepreneurs = Code Crew!

Passionate about learning how to code, creating beautiful designs or building the prototype for your business idea and tired of doing it alone? Then this is the group for you!

Want to learn how to build your own personal website, launch an MVP for a startup idea or take the first steps to a new career as a software developer without breaking the bank? If so then this group is for you! This is the perfect group for people serious about learning how to code. We provide affordable introductory class, courses and workshops on a myriad of programming topics. These topics include, but are not limited to, HTML, CSS, Javascript, Node.js, Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Python, Django, PHP, Objective-C, Swift, UI/UX Design and more!

If you are interested in learning through self-study using resources on the web like Code School, Codecademy, Treehouse, P2PU, Coursera, edX, Udacity, programming books, screencasts or whatever else is out there on the internet we have helpful suggested readings on our blog. If you're just starting out and want to get a head start then check out some cool resources here. 

To give back to the community we produce tech talks as well as run several outreach programs that aim to make the tech industry more diverse. You can learn more about these programs below:

HelloGirl! - a free coding bootcamp for women that teaches the basics of modern web development

I CODE NY - a free weekend coding bootcamp for underrepresented minorities that teaches the basics of web development and the technology industry

results.description:
The group will create a safe space to explore touch through lecture, exercises, and discussions.

We will explore how to reconnect with ourselves with the end goal of reducing stress, and experiencing healing and more pleasure in life. We will include new and old modalities (massage, Tantra, eye gazing, Reiki) to go beyond physical touch to explore energy, communication and intimacy in its different forms.

As humans, we crave touch. Not only is it important for our emotional and mental health, but physiologically we need touch as well. Extensive research shows that a lack of touch increases stress and anxiety levels, which at chronic high levels may damage normal existing brain tissue and impede brain tissue development in children. This may be one of the causes of some learning difficulties many children experience.

Studies have shown that in some European countries, individuals usually touch one another 100 times in the course of an hour conversation. In the United States that figure drops to…..3, we can do better, and in this group we learn the mechanics of how this is achieved. In this group you will:

  • Become aware of the different forms of touch and how to utilize them for more connection and fun in life
  • Release tension and feel more relaxed
  • Understand more about boundaries and how to create and maintain healthy boundaries
  • Learn techniques of how to connect with others on many levels
  • Quiet the mind and come to your senses
  • Feel more alive and comfortable in your body
  • Increase your ability to communicate and create on many levels
results.name: Massage NYC - Explore-Touch-Connect

results.description: Personal Data NYC (PDNYC) is the largest Meetup on the east coast focused on the personal data revolution.  Founded in February 2013, we have 800+ members who meet monthly to discuss the implications (positive and negative) of a world in which personal data has gone digital . Meetings typically include product demonstrations, lively panel discussions, and networking over food, beer, and wine.  The vibe is casual, but attendees are well-informed, passionate, and highly engaged.  Our members are a diverse cross section of professionals from media conglomerates, advertising agencies, advertisers, start-ups, venture capital firms, privacy advocacy groups, research organizations, academia, government, and the press.   Past topics have included regulatory and legislative initiatives (e.g., CISPA, COPPA, Consumer Privacy Bill of Rights), current events (e.g., the Snowden/NSA revelations, the machinations around the Do Not Track standard), and broader conversations about the legal constructs of personal data and how to value personal data.
results.name: Personal Data NYC (PDNYC)

results.description:
So... there has been a lot of fuss about this desktop 3D printing revolution thing for a while now. Still very exciting! 


We have a new-old idea that leaps beyond the news hype and celebrates the wonder of the activity itself. Let's get together every Thursday evening to explore this broad field, in all of its many facets and manifestations. And get to know each other better -- from bold pioneers, to new adopters, from teachers to students, manufacturing experts, to code and electronics hackers. This is your space to grow and share.

Topics we might explore on a typical Thursday evening include:

- 3D design software and techniques. From getting started, to pushing boundaries.

- Explore more of the 3D ecosystem, from making use of 3D printing service bureaus to starting and managing your 3D Hub.

- How to prototype and develop your own physical products, tools, and artwork.

- 3D printing materials: strategies for fabricating in more than just 1-2 plastics.

- Casting and mold-making: from precious metals to candy bars.

- Finishing techniques. Sanding, painting, sealing, melting, deforming, decorating, hydro-printing.... Why just make things that look like plastic?

Let's spend time together sorting out better ways to use these tools, and better ways to design.
results.name: 3D Thursdays! 3D Printing and Hacking

topics.name: Support Group for Panic & Anxiety Disorder

results.description: We are a LGBTQ peer-led discussion and support group dealing with emotional health, mental health, problems, and wellness; specifically for LGBTQ people. The group is for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Queer, Questioning, Intersex, Two-Spirit, and Asexual people. We aim to provide a safe, open and non-judgmental environment encouraging members to listen to each other, share experiences, interact, and learn ways to cope, heal and grow. We do this in an atmosphere of welcome, acceptance and empathy. We have our support group on the first Wednesday of the month at a West Village church in New York City. We also have our support group on the 2nd Thursday of the month at the LGBT Community Center in New York City. After both support groups, we usually get something to eat at a local diner or restaurant. We have a social get together at a Chelsea restaurant about two weeks after the Center group. We encourage members to talk from our own personal experience. We want the group to be a safe space and we stress confidentiality, as much as is humanly and realistically possible. We encourage respect, interaction, discussion and friendship, but we shy away from telling someone what they should do, and instead we give advice or feedback only if it is asked for. We discuss anxiety, depression, OCD, loneliness, relationship issues, work issues, etc. We don't guarantee answers or solutions, but we provide a space to come together to share. (This group is more for support and friendship and talking about our problems and issues; and not for professional networking nor research nor screenplays, etc. People might happen to learn ideas for jobs, but again the focus is on support and coming together.) The group is a joint effort among all members. We are not a 12 step group. We do not advocate any religion. We would like group attendance to reflect the diversity of people who join here on meetup. We have a diverse group of facilitators with respect to gender, age, and ethnicity. If people want to get more info. about the group, please e-mail at lgbtwellness411@hotmail.com. We ask for a contribution of $5, more or less, when you attend the groups, only if you can afford it, to cover the center room rental cost and the cost of being on meetup. We realize these are tough times. The most important thing is that you attend the groups, regardless of one's ability to pay. We also realize that people who attend the groups for the first time may feel awkward or nervous. We want you to feel as welcome and comfortable as is possible. No one has to talk if they are uncomfortable or nervous, but if new attendees want to share and talk about certain things, please try to let your voice and opinions be heard, and tell us what you want to talk about, and tell us what you need from the group. We can ask you if you would like to talk about anything, but we don't want to put you on the spot. This group is a joint effort, so we will do our best to include everyone. We are all learning from each other, listening, adapting, and growing. Thank you.
results.name: NYC LGBTQ SUPPORTIVE CONNECTIONS

results.description:
If you've zoned out after 25 minutes of a tech talk and left the presentation remembering less than half of what you heard, this is your group. At Skillshare, we believe in learning by doing, so we're going to host regular Tech Skillshares for developers in NYC. Each Tech Skillshare will be led by a developer or leader in tech, and the format will be Learn (a quick talk), Do (you get to practice what you've just learned), then Feedback (time to mingle and share your work with the other attendees). We hope you'll join in and get your hands dirty!

Membership is by approval, and only technical people (with a focus on developers) are allowed to join.

Why, you ask? Because the goal is to have an ongoing learning group for technical people (esp. in startups) where they can level up and add to the skills they already have.

We meet on the first Monday of every month and have a speaker on relevant topics, from general topics, like how to create great engineering culture, to technology areas , like how to make the best use of Git.
results.name: NYC Tech Skillshares

results.description:
Culture Labx is a global community for founders, designers, and practitioners to experiment with ways of inspiring more enlightened company cultures. 

In 2013, a group of us came together to elevate the conversation of what company culture is and isn’t. We believed it was time to move away from pizza and pingpong, and refocus on the essence of any great company —the people.

Culture Labx now has chapters in 7 cities around the world. Here in New York, we host events a few times a year to discuss a range of topics on workplace culture.
results.name: CULTURE LABx NY

This group is for people who value and enjoy deeper discussions with amazing people and who are also willing to rise to the occasion by joining us to help make these discussion opportunities an ongoing reality.

The events held in this group are all about having fun nights of great people and 'deeper' discussions over dinner in a charming restaurant. This Meetup group was created by Glen Brauer as part of a non-profit global initiative using practical philosophy to bring together strangers to build community. This Meetup group is now part of a network of over 15,000 members located in cities around the world.


Click here to visit our home page:

http://PhilosophyDinners.org


Our events involve the following proven formula:

- open-minded individuals who are as intelligent as they are friendly

- 1 thought-provoking topic provided in advance so you have time to ponder it

- Food for Thought page provided in advance of event 

- events are held in a charming restaurant

- restaurant is close to public transportation

- 6 people at each table (so everyone has a chance to speak)

- 1 discussion facilitator at each table (members take turns being facilitators)

- thought-provoking questions (discussion notes) are provided to our facilitators in order to stimulate the discussions.


The feedback from these events held around the world has been very positive. (Click here to view feedback). There are no membership fees but a small fee is required when signing up for events which goes towards Meetup costs, the time required to research and produce the discussions notes, booking restaurant reservations, scheduling the events, and coordinating the facilitators.

If this sounds interesting to you then click "Join Us" on the top-right of this screen then RSVP to events when they are posted. Members receive email notifications when new events are scheduled.


The Philosophy Dinners Facebook Group

The purpose of the Philosophy Dinners Facebook group is to cultivate the global citizen mindset; by enriching our perspectives through the sharing of insights before and after the events take place in our individual cities.

Click here to join the Philosophy Dinners Facebook Group


You may also be interested in:

http://PsychologyDinners.org
results.name: New York Philosophy Dinners

David Kinnear

Most Jews are surprised to learn that there is such a thing as "Jewish" meditation. If you consider yourself "spiritual" and you'd like to learn how to use meditation and visualization techniques to improve your life, or share your knowledge in that area, consider joining us.

Together we will learn how to be more alert and aware much of the time

We will learn how to eliminate negative thoughts and negative moods which are harmful to our health.

We will learn how to raise our level of consciousness and be in harmony with those around us.

We will learn visualization techniques which will help attract into our lives the things we wish for (health, finding a soul-mate, financial success, etc.).

Hope to see you at one of our meetings soon...

results.description:
Who We Are


Are you a reporter, producer, editor, or broadcasting professional here in NYC or elsewhere? We would love to have you join us for in depth discussions about the role of the media, new technology, production techniques, interviewing and editing skills, or just to network with like-minded professionals.

 

New York Broadcasting Group is a non-profit organization that supports the New York media community. Our goal is to help build a sustainable media industry that drives economic growth, leads innovation, and creates positive, high-impact change for our local communities and the world.

 

Contact Information


nate@nateplutzik.com

Twitter: @NYBroadcast

 

What We Do


Connect * Explore * Inspire * Educate * Collaborate * Learn*

We connect members of the media community with each other and with resources to help them build and connect with successful, sustainable media companies. We amplify the work of the New York media community by providing platforms from which they can showcase their work or skills. We inspire innovation and growth by exposing the community to new ideas and leading-edge technology.

results.description:
Come join me for a  mommy and baby yoga class. I am a certified yoga instructor looking to offer moms and babies in our community affordable yoga classes. Practice yoga with your baby while learning to regain the strength of your abdominal and pelvic floor muscles. Awaken your whole body, release tention and most importantly bond and play with your little one as well as socialize with other mommies.

" "Becoming a parent is stressful, and yoga can help ease new-parent jitters as well as afford mothers and fathers the opportunity to nourish and care for their own bodies through focused stretches and mindful breathing exercises," says Chaitoff.

It Can Aid in Digestion for Baby

The poses and movements chosen for baby yoga are not done at random. "It's a wonderful thing to see in class when tired mamas come in for the first time with their sometimes colicky or fussy little one, and through the movements you can see the babies begin to calm down," says DeNino.


 It Can Help Baby Sleep Better
Ask any new mom what she wants most, and she's sure to tell you that she'd love more sleep. DeNino explains that "the class experience is just the right amount of stimulation they need to help them sleep for longer stretches of time. Many moms have told me that it's so much easier getting baby down for their afternoon nap after our yoga class."


 It Keeps Baby Happy Through Repetitive, Soothing Motions
"Most babies enjoy movement, so the class is different from a traditional yoga class in that we spend the majority of the class in constant motion without holding one pose for too long. We also incorporate music, singing and gentle yoga stretches for baby," states DeNino." Care.com

As a mom of two energetic, happy kids, I speak from personal experience saying that a regular practice of yoga can improve and maintain a wellbeing of an entire family, bringing countless benefits to parents and little ones! Reduced stress, improved blood circulation, gentle stretches and increased strength and most importantly peace of mind are all things every parent could use!
results.name: Mommy and Baby Yoga Class

results.description:
Speak English. Make Friends. Be a New Yorker!

New York English is a diverse community of fun and friendly people. This group is designed for everyone who wants to improve their English in a fun and casual way. ALL LEVELS of English, from beginner to advanced, are welcome! We create events for each and all levels.

If you join New York English, you will enjoy participating in cultural events and conversation while practicing their English with a native English speaker, who is an experienced, friendly, and patient ESL teacher. We invite you to become a member and immerse yourself in BOTH language and culture, have fun and make tons of friends!

We plan different types of meetups for our members.
• Large informal English conversation events in Manhattan
• Smaller monthly workshops for each level (Beginners, Intermediate, and Advanced) that focus on conversation, pronunciation, grammar, and other tricky topics.
• Private movie screenings in English with subtitles and a social/conversation hour
• New York Culture! -- guided museum visits, walking tours, theater, dance, concerts, food and more!

There is a nominal charge (nonrefundable) for each event, primarily in order to discourage no-shows and to defray the cost of organizing meetup events.

results.description:
This workshop/presentation series will cover design stretching from many areas: UI, UX, Wearables & Fashion, Web, algorithmic e.t.c through short expert talks and interactive design exercises. It will focus on growing fields in technology and how design plays a part in each of them. The free workshops, which are only for students, will meet Mondays at 5:30pm sometimes weekly, sometimes biweekly.

Design is about creating something to achieve a goal. Maybe you want to design an iPhone app to help people eat more healthily. Or maybe you want to create a piece of public policy to make financial markets more stable, or to structure an organization so that it operates more efficiently. Maybe you want to see how code and design are coming together to create user-friendly wearables or interactive installation. 

No matter what your goal, in order to achieve it, you’ll need to generate, implement, and evaluate various ideas and pick the best ones. Then you need to make them work. Design is the science for doing this.

results.description:
The Society of Physician Entrepreneurs (www.sopenet.org) is a not-for-profit 501(c)6 global biomedical and healthcare innovation network. We use the term "Physician" loosely to include all who are in the healthcare world who have an idea or desire to improve it or make a contribution. This would include physicians, dentists, chiropractors, nurses, physician assistants, biomedical engineers, etc. Members include healthcare entrepreneurs, investors, service providers, and industry representatives. The mission of SoPE is to help biomedical and healthcare entrepreneurs get their ideas, discoveries and inventions to market by providing them with education, connections to service providers & investors.

We try to hold meetings every 2 months during the academic year from 6:30 -9:30. Typically we hold meetings in mid-town Manhattan but we are also trying to arrange meetings in Connecticut and New Jersey.

Meetings typically have three scheduled features: (1) networking; (2) subject presentation on business issues (e.g., finance, FDA, IP, marketing, etc.); and (3) a Company presentation by a member. We insist that at the meeting there be no solicitation of investments or business and dress code is business appropriate as one may see at a big law firm or financial services company.

Individuals may attend one meeting free as a guest of ours, after which you will be expected to join SOPE. SOPE membership entitles you to attend our chapter meetings for free. Potential business sponsors will be charged $100 to attend the first meeting and will have that amount deducted from sponsorship costs.

Please contact us for details.

Steve Levine         slevine@sopenet.net

Larry Kunstadt      lkunstadt@sopenet.net
results.name: Society of Physician Entrepreneurs (SoPE): New York TriState

results.description:
The Alternative Banking Working Group of Occupy meets every Sunday from 3-5pm at Columbia University, in Room 409 of the International Affairs Building at the corner of 118th and Amsterdam Avenue.

We typically get about 20 people (most of whom are on our e-mail list, not meetup).

We are open to everyone. If you are press, please identify yourself before the meeting begins. Also, we don’t allow any recording devices at the meetings, and if you want to quote someone you need their explicit permission for each quote.

To learn more about us, see our web site and for the sort of topics we discuss, the "News" page.

We usually send out topics on Saturday and ask for more topics. To get on the list please email alt.banking.OWS@gmail.com and request to be added to the email list for Alt Banking.

The format of the meetings are as follows:

  1. We list the topics and discuss them briefly to give people an idea of what they are.
  2. We vote for the topics to see who wants to discuss what.
  3. The top 2-4 topics are chosen, and we have two rounds of discussions in which people are free to choose whichever topic they choose.
  4. People take minutes and when the groups are large enough someone takes stack as well.
  5. After the two rounds, we have a quick summary of the discussions.

When we can get good speakers, we schedule them from 2-3 before the regular meeting.
results.name: Alternative Banking Group - Occupy Wall Street of NYC

If you are interested in learning Reiki, participating in Reiki Healing Circles and gathering with the positive life force energy of Reiki, this is the meetup group for you.  Our events will always include Reiki (during any event that you attend, Reiki is given to each individual as a continuous flow throughout the event) and will also include a variety of other self-related activities, such as Yoga, Meditation, the Law of Attraction, manifestation, Eckhart Tolle, and more.  All levels and lineages of Reiki Practitioners through Reiki Masters are welcome and you are welcome even if you are not a Practitioner or Master but would like to learn more about Reiki or be around Reiki.  The mission of this group is to promote positive thinking, self acceptance, self love, Yoga, Reiki, and inner reflection to enhance and support inner peace.  This meetup is here to nourish your mind, body and infinite spirit.  We come together in a peaceful environment to share positivity, positive thoughts and positive vibrations with each other and the world.  If you would like even more information please join our group and also please visit www.CliftonYogaNJ.com or email me directly :).  Peace.....Amanda :)

results.description: Clear Mountain Zen Center is a place to practice Zen Buddhism in a supportive and caring environment offering introductory courses for those interested in exploring Zen Buddhism, as well as full practice support, activities, and ceremonies for meingmbers. Membership in the Center is open to all. Zen training, while it arises out of the Buddhist tradition, can serve as a valuable adjunct to any religion, calming and centering the mind and promoting stablity, mindfulness, and clarity. If you are interested in becoming involved with Zen Practice, or just want to sit quietly, we invite you to practice with us. Clear Mountain Zen Center opens many gates to living a Zen life, free from the constraints of delusion and for the benefit of all beings. Zen practice is both introspective and social. The benefits of Zen meditation include: - clarity of mind and increased self-understanding - greater compassion for yourself and for others - ability ot handle situations previously difficult to deal with - more creative approach to life - reduced stress and improved concentration - spiritual, emotional, and even physiologicasl balance - mindfulness of your actions, your surroundings, and your time - increased self-confidence and self-esteem
results.name: Clear Mountain Zen Center

results.description:
Russian Language enrichment classes for babies and kids in New York City (Midtown East).

This New York City Russian language enrichment group is for children (from 6 months to 5 years old), who would like to hear (for babies) and practice (for toddlers and kids) Russian language during educational and creative classes, designed for each age category separately. This group is best suited for children, who's first language is Russian or for children who are exposed to the language on a daily basis and have a basic understanding of it, however, everyone else is welcomed to participate as well!  Children have to be accompanied by adult caretakers. 2 types of classes are offered:

1. Express yourself in Russian (Russian through music, songs, poems and movement).  Ages 6 months - 5 years old.

2. Russian language (introduction to Russian language in fun and engaging way by developing and improving vocabulary and working on fine and gross motor skills. Building a foundation for early literacy skills.). Ages 24 months - 5 years old.

Each class is 40-45 minutes long, depending on age category.  Classes are led by professional Russian speaking teachers.

Location - Midtown East (Manhattan).
