results.description:
This group welcomes any and all types of recruiters and HR professionals; technical and non-technical, agency and in-house. The only requirement is that you’re interested in sharing your skills and expertise to promote a more socially and economically just community.

 

This group will support various local NY/NJ non-profits and socially-driven start-ups and organizations through direct and purposeful action:

* Partner with non-profit employment services to provide resume-writing workshops, mock interview sessions, and general job searching pro-tips to those that are unemployed.

* Utilize our networks to deliver talent (technical and non-technical ) to non-profits and socially-driven start-ups who may not have the necessary resources to hire a staffing agency.

* Help with the up-skilling of these organizations in their hiring, interviewing, and HR processes

 

This group will also bring together a community of awesome recruiters. Together, we'll:

* Brainstorm the endless other ways we can put our skills to good use and, hopefully, inspire the larger recruiting community to leverage their talent for good.

* Share some drinks and hilarious interviewing stories
results.name: Recruiters for Good

results.description:
This is a group formed by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs.

Our Mission: The creation of a vibrant entrepreneurial community in New Jersey so that entrepreneurs have the necessary tools available to launch their startups.

Collaboration: We are a collaborative movement which is looking to work with any group that shares our passion for entrepreneurship. We are not in competition with NYC, Philly or any other group.

Necessary Tools:

• Developers & Business Development professionals: building blocks of an entrepreneurial community

• CoWork Spaces: Melting pots in which companies are started

• New Blood/Ideas/Energy: Collaborate with teaching institutions and make entrepreneurs who are working in silos aware of the community

• Educational Collaboration: Incubators, accelerator, entrepreneurial programs, STEM in high schools etc…..

• Investors: They don’t think we have enough quality companies in NJ to warrant their time. Let’s prove them wrong.

• Government: We don’t expect a lot but every little bit helps. Helping with cowork spaces is a good start.

Past & Present:

New Jersey is the home of Thomas Edison, Bell Labs and was the epicenter of the Pharmaceutical industry and Telco. We also have a highly educated population, great businesses, close proximity to NYC and/or Philly and a well-developed educational system. However, if you look at lists of top states for entrepreneurship and innovation New Jersey never makes it. The great thing is that this is showing signs of changing. NJ Tech, Jersey Shore Tech and Princeton Tech have proven, by their stellar growth, that New Jersey wants/needs an entrepreneurial ecosystem.

LaunchNJ (Not for profit):

Madison Tech has pivoted and is now called LaunchNJ. Our sole mission is the creation of an entrepreneurial community in New Jersey. This group is run by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs so we figured it only made sense to run it like a startup. We will take chances, measure results and iterate or pivot as needed.

MVP:

Use the voice of LaunchNJ to support the creation of Special Interest Groups (SIG’s): (i.e. Life Sciences, Developers, Female Entrepreneurs)

Create events that provide high value for entrepreneurs: (workshops, deep dives, co-founder date night etc.)

Make members aware of events occurring around the state (aggregate)

Celebrate New Jersey company wins =’s create buzz

The Bottom Line:

New Jersey has all the building blocks necessary to build an entrepreneurial and innovation hub, the movement has started. Since this is a grassroots movement we need you. None of the organizers are getting paid but they are working hard to deliver high impact programs and will continue to do so. However, if we are to succeed we need your help. Please let other entrepreneurs or entrepreneurial people know about the group. It is a great opportunity for them to learn and you are helping your community.

Definitions:

Entrepreneurial: A person who sees a problem and fixes it without having to be told and is willing to share knowledge with others.

Entrepreneur: An Entrepreneurial Person who chooses to take the plunge and commit themselves 100% to something that has a high probability of failing.
results.name: LaunchNJ: Entrepreneurial Tech Hub

results.description:
What is Apache CloudStack?

Apache CloudStack is open source software designed to deploy and manage large networks of virtual machines, as a highly available, highly scalable Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) cloud computing platform. CloudStack is used by a number of service providers to offer public cloud services, and by many companies to provide an on-premises (private) cloud offering, or as part of a hybrid cloud solution.

CloudStack is a turnkey solution that includes the entire "stack" of features most organizations want with an IaaS cloud: compute orchestration, Network-as-a-Service, user and account management, a full and open native API, resource accounting, and a first-class User Interface (UI).

CloudStack currently supports the most popular hypervisors: VMware, KVM, XenServer,Xen Cloud Platform (XCP), LXC, and Hyper-V.

Users can manage their cloud with an easy to use Web interface, command line tools, and/or a full-featured RESTful API. In addition, CloudStack provides an API that's compatible with AWS EC2 and S3 for organizations that wish to deploy hybrid clouds. Learn more at. cloudstack.apache.org.

Join the CloudStack NYC Users Group

Anyone is welcome! Come and chat over pizza and drinks.

We will have talks from members of the foundation, committers, and users of CloudStack discussing various aspects of its development, history, architecture, operation and in general the direction of the project in this and upcoming meetups. And most importantly - how to get started on contributing yourself! Anyone is welcome to the group and we'll have beginner sessions available as well.
results.name: CloudStack NYC User Group

results.description:
"The constructed language with the most complete grammar is probably Lojban - a language created to reflect the principles of logic." --- Arika Okrent, the author of In the Land of Invented Languages

 

coi ro do (Hello Everyone!)

This group is for people who are interested in and want to know about the constructed language, Lojban.

Lojban is a one of the most complete, carefully designed, and logically unambiguous constructed languages in the world.

Lojban has a number of features which make it unique: (quoted from lojban.org)
- Lojban is designed to be used by people in communication with each other, and possibly in the future with computers.
- Lojban is designed to be culturally neutral.
- Lojban has an unambiguous grammar, which is based on the principles of logic.
- Lojban has phonetic spelling, and unambiguous resolution of sounds into words.
- Lojban is simple compared to natural languages; it is easy to learn.
- Lojban's 1300 root words can be easily combined to form a vocabulary of millions of words.
- Lojban is regular; the rules of the language are without exception.
- Lojban attempts to remove restrictions on creative and clear thought and communication.
- Lojban has a variety of uses, ranging from the creative to the scientific, from the theoretical to the practical.
results.name: Lojban NYC

results.description:
On Twitter: @eanewyorkcity
On Facebook: New York Effective Altruists
Web: effectivealtruism.nyc

Are you motivated to do something that makes the world a better place? Do you want to have the biggest impact you possibly can? We each have limited resources with which to affect the world. Figuring out how to invest these resources to accomplish the most good can be difficult, involving a lot of research, strategy, and math. Fortunately, we don't have to do it alone.

Effective Altruism is a growing movement of people looking to maximize their impact on the world. We take our moral obligations toward others seriously and look for ways to do good for others that wouldn't otherwise be done. Whether you consider yourself a dedicated effective altruist, are curious about the economic and philosophical ideas behind the movement, or just want to do a little more good on the margins, we invite you to join us!

If you'd like to read about some of the ideas behind Effective Altruism, a good place to start is the "Introduction" page on the Effective Altruism Forum website.

In Sri Sri Yoga, the techniques of Yoga are taught in a light, joyful and thorough manner – equally useful and suitable for different levels of Yoga students, from beginners to advanced.

Sri Sri Yoga beautifully combines all the following aspects –

  • Yoga Asanas/Postures – for the well-being of the body and mind (Hatha Yoga)
  • Pranayama – to awaken the kundalini & regulating the flow of prana (Kundalini Yoga)
  • Meditation – to nurture the mind and spirit (Raja Yoga)
  • Knowledge – practical wisdom to deal with the challenges of daily life (Gyan Yoga)
  • Satsang – singing and celebrating (Bhakti Yoga)
  • Seva – an opportunity to get involved in service projects (Karma Yoga)

Through powerful and enjoyable yoga process, you will come to contact with your body in a more intimate and profound manner. The process will take you through the unification of the mind, body and breath, you will experience deep relaxation and powerful recharge. You will acquire the key to yoga asana and settling of the mind, and will deepen your experience through practices and the guidance of the instructor.

topics.name: Kundalini Yoga as taught by Yogi Bhajan

results.description:
Health and Happiness is your birthright! So, Let's start from the beginning, shall we?! Let's get together for some life changing, energy stimulating, mind centering and soul awakening KUNDALINI YOGA and MEDITATION!

Kundalini Yoga has no beginning and no end, so what do I mean beginning Kundalini Yoga?? Kundalini Yoga is a Yoga of Awareness, so in this group we will approach yoga with a new and fresh look at Kundalini Yoga practice. Whether you are a new or seasoned practitioner, come and joins us and explore this ancient practice. It is for anyone searching for complete Union of Being: physical, mental, spiritual! It is for every body, age, physical ability. It meets you where you are at and takes you where you want to go!

Master the basis: Long deep breathing, breath of fire, eye focus, "the locks", mantra pronunciation and meaning, postures and mudras.

The Kundalini Energy is awareness itself. It organizes all the other energies in the body. If its flow is open and correct, healing results occur with almost miraculous impact. Our fears and attachments often disturb the normal flow of energy and functioning of the first three chakras. When that flow is opened and reconnected to the higher centers, the nervous system, glands and chakras all synchronize. A deep rejuvenation cascades throughout the body.

“Your mind is your servant, your body is your vehicle and your soul is your residence.” Yogi Bhajan

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Montclair NJ Kundalini Yoga and Meditation Meetup Group

Come sing!!! We're bringing people who love to sing together to form a community.

Gatherings, jam sessions and choir rehearsals incorporate singing together, learning music, some vocal technique and training, and community building exercises and games.

We're starting off less frequent and will build to more regular rehearsals/gatherings.

Music selections will be moving, enlightening, enlivening, conscious, healing, inspiring, non-denominational, fun, deep. All musical styles - gospel, pop, rock, musical theatre, chants, folk, medicine songs.

Musicians, singers - express interest by joining this group!

Prerequisites:
1) You love to sing
2) You love to play and create community
3) You are inspired by using your voice and music as a way of connecting with others

Do I have to be a "singer"?
No - you just have to love to sing!

Do I have to be on pitch?
No, but some more difficult or finely tuned songs with tight harmonies may be sung by sub-sets of our choir who have above average musicianship

 

Note from Amy : I used to be in a community choir at Sacred Center NY - we sang Gospel Style Music with new thought, inspirational lyrics. My favorite aspects of being part of the choir were - rehearsals, singing music that raised my consciousness and vibration, the healing of singing and making music with others, the close community formed. I did love our performances, but honestly got so much more out of our rehearsals and dinners-out and talks on breaks etc... I talk to so many people who love to sing - so let's come together and form something.

 

Also on Facebook here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/529840427030696/events/

Please join the facebook group too - it will help us be sure that you're getting communications from other group members...

results.description:
Great Music Played By Anyone....For Everyone

New Westchester Symphony Orchestra is an ensemble where anyone can play the greatest orchestral music ever written.

Our Mission: The New Westchester Symphony Orchestra (NewWSO) offers amateur instrumental musicians in and around Westchester County an opportunity to build musicianship in a supportive, non-competitive setting while practicing and performing significant orchestral and ensemble works.

Who Can Play: NewWSO is an audition-free ensemble for musicians of all ages and abilities. Anyone who wants to play great works of orchestral literature can do so with us. When possible, we play from the exact same editions that the great orchestras of the world play from. So, next time you hear the first movement of Mozart's 40th Symphony being played on WQXR, you will recognize your part and say, "Hey, I can play that...sort of!"

Our Conductor: Conductor Benjamin Niemczyk is understanding, patient, and brings us together in the spirit of making great music. There are more than a few wrong notes here and there and he doesn't yell at us, we just keep trying. So come play with us no matter how long it's been. No need to brush up before playing with us, our friendly musicians will make you feel right at home.

Rehearsals and Concerts: We rehearse weekly and we play concerts in the community approximately once per month. Don't sweat either one, we're a relaxed bunch and know that people are busy. Just rehearse and perform when you can. Concerts are always volunteer, we don't make you perform. Visit our website for much more info on who we are, what we play, and where we play.

Join us at any one of our weekly rehearsals to check us out. You may not see many RSVPs here because most of our members are not on Meetup. You will walk into a room of 35-45 musicians when you come. Everybody is very friendly and welcoming, so don't be too shy. Just come!

What instruments do we need? Currently we have openings for following instruments:

    Oboe

    Bassoon

    French Horn

    Violin

    Viola

    Cello

    Bass

If you play flute, clarinet, trumpet, percussion, or piano, contact us regarding available spots as we may have a waiting list. That being said, if you play these instruments but also play another instrument or are willing to learn another instrument, we won't turn you away. We welcome musicians who have an adventurous spirit.

If you are a pro: We are an all-volunteer ensemble whose musicians do not get paid to perform, nor do we pay "ringers" to play with us. If you're a professional musician or a really awesome amateur and want to play with us, that's great! But we don't pay in cash, let's just get that out of the way. Your payment will be the great feeling of playing with a group of enthusiastic music lovers, and a little fame if that's your thing.

NewWSO is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization and is a "pay to play" ensemble. Your first rehearsal is free of charge, to see if you like the repertoire and the people. If you decide to join, we ask for a contribution of $10/rehearsal OR a pro-rated annual contribution to cover rehearsal space rental and administrative costs. However, if a financial contribution is not possible for you, we can work something out. Please let us know your situation and we are more than happy to accommodate in a way that is fair for everyone.
results.name: New Westchester Symphony Orchestra

results.description:
NYC Data Engineering hosts events where the lead engineers from pre-screened companies showcase their technical challenges.
ONLY ENGINEERS can attend. If you are not an engineer, please be aware that you may be removed from the group.

Software engineers are presently faced with an ever-increasing amount of data as well as a plethora of options for open-source technologies to use to manage it. And the architectures required to process the data into useful information using machine learning, NLP, analytics, etc. are constantly evolving. The NYC Data Engineering Meetup tackles the real-world issues in data processing architectures. For our talks we invite top engineers with previous experience in building online, offline and nearline processing systems and ask them to tell us about lessons learned in building their architectures. We're also interested in the practical applications of data science and machine learning, and explore the best ways that current advancements in those fields can be worked into production level data-oriented architectures. If you're involved in data engineering or data science at any level and are looking for real-world engineering war stories on data processing architectures, please join us.
results.name: NYC Data Engineering

results.description:
This is a group designed for guitar beginners and intermediates.

We start each meeting with a group lesson and then form small groups to learn songs based on skill levels. We make an effort to put vocals into the individual groups depending on vocal ability and availability. Each group works on a few specific songs chosen by the group and the instructor. The instructor(s) reviews each group during the meetup and provides aid and comments.

The goal is to provide each group (and their individual members) with a set of songs so that each member comes away with a their own repertoire. This is not a "group play-along" type meetup but rather one which teaches the member their own set of playable songs.

Our own experiences tell us that learning specific songs as a small group promotes quicker learning than practicing on your own.  Group work encourages the student to learn at their optimum level. Moreover, actually learning to play songs as finished products results in a rewarding experience.
results.name: MetroJersey Novice Guitarists Workshops

results.description:
Certified Nurse Case Manager and Grief Recovery Specialist

Welcome to Death Café New York City!

The idea of a Café Mortel (or "Death Café") comes from the work of Swiss sociologist Bernard Crettaz.  Jon Underwood in the UK ran with the idea, November 2010. Today, Death Cafés are held in over 29 countries. Death Café New York City adopts the "salon" model: free-flowing conversation around the topic of death from-any-angle.  

What distinguishes a classic Death Café?

    Great hosts:  Audrey Pellicano, Certified Nurse Case Manager and Grief Recovery Specialist; and Nancy Gershman, memory artist at VNSNY/Haven Hospice

    We're a non-for-profit;

    Free of facilitators, guest speakers or agenda;

    With no intention of leading participants towards any particular conclusion, product, belief system, or course of action;

    Drawing together individuals of every kind of spiritual/ philosophical/ religious/intellectual beliefs, pursuits or questions;

    Encouraging members to support one another and continue their conversations outside Death Café;


See you soon!

Audrey Pellicano and Nancy Gershman
results.name: Death Café New York City

results.description:
This group is for anyone who wants to learn to cook anything from the very basics to expanding their home cooking repertoire. I specialize in teaching simple, easily reproducible meals that are healthy, tasty and mostly quick to make! Many are family friendly and I throw some in that are definitely company friendly! Did your mom work and not get to teach you much about cooking? Did you grow up in a house that made mostly things from boxes and cans? Were you the youngest and got left by the wayside when everyone else was in the kitchen? Well come join us!! I will teach you what you need to know to become a good home cook. Feed your family and feed them well. Classes are usually $55 per class but if cost is an issue please call and talk to me! I give discounts for multi class registrations, groups, couples, kids etc. We make food, we eat it, we take some home! You will get your money's worth!!!

My goal is to share with you what I believe is an important life skill.(and share with you the passion that goes along with it!)

You see I also believe LIFE HAPPENS IN THE KITCHEN. All joys, sorrows, and big decisions in life happen in the kitchen or at table.  Come learn about food and all that happens where food is made!

My mottos are these....

"Life is all about the food... make it good!"

"Do not neglect to show hospitality to strangers, for thereby some have entertained angels unawares."

Ecclesiastes 8:15 Then I commended mirth, because a man has no better thing under the sun, than to eat, and to drink, and to be merry: for that shall abide with him in his labor all the days of his life, which God gives him under the sun.
results.name: Learn to Cook-Dorina's Italian Kitchen-Madison, NJ

results.description:
United East Athletics Association is a established 501(c)3 non-profit and self-funded organization. Our goal is to reach out and help those in the Lower Manhattan community by providing programs that will enhance their quality of life. Soccer is one of the many programs we offer in our organization. For more information please go to ueaa.org.

We are a NON-PROFIT organization not like the others. (view our 501c3 status)

Where we play? - Lower Manhattan - Columbus Park and Queens - LIC - Queens West Sports Field

Who should join? - Beginners, intermediate and advanced players are welcomed to join. People that likes competitive and friendly play.

Why play with us? - We organize our meetup for players and not for profit.

Rules: Games are played 7 aside with 6 field players and a keeper. Participants will be expected to take turns in goal during the course of a session.

    Games are 10 minutes each or 2 goals. Winning team stays on or if tied the new team stays.

    Absolutely no slide tackling.

    We play on a turf field so wear appropriate shoes.

    Balls and pinnies will be provided.

    Good sportsmanship is mandatory.

All players who RSVP must Read and Agree to the following terms -
http://www.ueaa.org/pdfs/ueaa-waiver.pdf
results.name: NYC/Queens Co-Ed Pickup Soccer

results.description:
Welcome to 20-something Fabulous NY Ladies. This group is for all ladies living in New York City age 21-29 who are interested in making new friends and having a great time! Whether you just got here or are only now finally getting around to exploring this awesome city you now call home - this is the group for you!


NYC is an amazing town with tons of places for food, drinks, shopping and so much more to do. :D


If there's an event you wish to attend or a place you wish to check out (restaurant, pub, bar, boutique, gym, etc), feel free to post a suggestion and find others to join you from the group!  I'm open to most suggestions!

While our group has grown considerably over the past few months, we tend to have varied events - some with 20+, others under 10 ladies attending.   Rest assured - we all have fun :) I think if you end up spending more than 6 hours with certain people - you like the company :D

*** Please note : I try my best to ensure we have events that are fun and affordable/worth the money.  As a member of this group, I ask that you please honor your RSVP or cancel in a timely manner, and most importantly - please be respectful of other members.  Behaving in a manner that is rude, disrespectful and mean will not be tolerated.  I will kick out anyone who acts like  they are on reality TV and it's sweeps week.  As a member of this group, your actions and words should not reflect poorly on the rest of us.  Being kicked out/banned from an establishment is not lady-like.  Calling people names or making other members feel unwelcome because they look or seem different will not be tolerated.  I thought this was common courtesy, but apparently, it's not.  I'm very strict about this.***


I would like this to become a wonderful, supportive community.  Hence, I am seeking members who will be active.  At least come to the group page and contribute some feedback or attend an event at least once every few months.  Ladies inactive for longer than 6 months will be removed.  But you're always welcome to re-apply.


Looking forward to seeing you at our next event!


PS - Please have a real photo of yourself - not your dog/beach/etch-a-sketch.  Your request to join the group will be declined. I'm sorry but i need to make sure I have real people (specifically - real women) joining this group.  NO exceptions.

results.description:
Tagine provides live music and bellydance shows every week. To book your table please call 646-373-6265. To view our Moroccan cuisine menu please visit: www.taginedining.com

To book a private party call Marisa at: 646-373-6265 or email her at: taginedining@gmail.com.

If you are a performer and would like to perform at Tagine please contact Marisa at: taginedining@gmail.com with the subject "performing"

Like a rose that blossoms out of a sidewalk crack, Tagine sweetens the NYC theatre district with an exotic and alluring perfume. Moroccan lamps, handwoven berber textiles and cushy seating create an understated elegance. Habitues of the restaurant/lounge steep themselves in the Maghreb, sipping luscious orange blossom sangria, savoring fragrant tagines, entranced by belly dancers and hookah pipes. What a shock to step outside, following this amazing melange of sensory delights and find not camels and dunes, but rather midtown Manhattan!



Aside from the beautiful and comfortably decorated interior, Tagine's kitchen is dynamic, baking its own semolina bread daily, and encasing its own lamb merguez. A variety of 'Tagines' are featured at the restaurant. There are several different cous cous selections on the menu, and mouthwatering house specialties include "bastilla", a Moroccan pheasant pie, and "moquadimat," a selection of appetizers, ordered a la carte or as a mixed platter. Included in the wine list, is a diverse selection of Moroccan varieties, which delightfully accompany the menu. Don't walk away from your table without sampling "Halahwyat" the most delightful, hand rolled traditional confections and pastries, graciously served with mint tea or Moroccan spiced coffee.



We have been hosting, catering and entertaining palates and bodies for over 12 years. Our new location boasts a generous bar, hookah lounge, semi private room and, as always,  one of the lasting live music venues in Manhattan.  Our concept is the cohabitation of flavors, aromas, palettes and palates:)   The merging of cross cultural arts, artists performances while dining on slow, authentic and artisanal cuisine is our mission and brand.  Hence our namesake, Tagine- Share the Experience



We are the only artisanal Moroccan restaurant that has a variety of gluten free dishes on our in-house menu as well as an executive chef who can accommodate any dietary request.
results.name: Bellydance USA!

results.description:
Are you:
- Passionate about stereoscopy?
- A stereoscopic 3D professional?
- Interested in 3D and want to find out more?
- Or, have you never experienced stereo vision?

Join the new 3D Club of NY and enjoy the magical world of stereoscopic 3D!

We are a group of passionate Stereographers organized to promote the art, practice, enjoyment and science of Stereoscopic 3D (S3D) imaging. We'll conduct scheduled open meetings (with 3D projections and programs), events, workshops, competitions, exhibitions, labs, discussions, forums and many other social activities.

We welcome 3D content creators, fans of cinema, gamers, software developers and manufacturers. Whether you enjoy View-Master® images or experiment with the latest S3D hardware & software, you're encouraged to join our growing organization.

Come exchange ideas. Collaborate on projects, demonstrate your products, promote your business and share your knowledge. Discover the stereoscopic past and help to shape it's future. All are welcome: from the curious to amateurs to advanced specialists.

Historically, broad acceptance of 3D has been limited by analog technologies. Presenting stereo images was problematic and the results caused eyestrain and headaches. But emerging digital capture and display technologies are revolutionizing stereoscopic content creation and delivery.

An exciting era of Stereoscopic 3D imaging has begun and S3D is a rapidly growing market. Stereoscopy is the most natural method of visualization and there is an ever increasing demand for S3D content and services.

S3D has practical uses in numerous professional fields including, architecture - real estate - art - entertainment - medical - science - education - training - marketing - gaming - publishing - product design - manufacturing - data visualization. It opens up new possibilities for creativity and exciting new business opportunities.

The goal of the 3D Club of NY is to cultivate and advance the art of Stereoscopy by providing a creative hub for the Greater New York Area and linking it to the global S3D community.

 Your participation and input will drive the club forward. Come join us!
results.name: 3D Club of NY

results.description:
Come Together For Health™

Improving access to affordable healthcare by promoting innovative technologies that transform healthcare.

Health Technology Forum (HTF) is a platform for people worldwide who have a common interest in making healthcare better, more accessible and affordable. Our international network of technology and healthcare entrepreneurs, developers, regulators, and providers are advancing the pace of healthcare innovation by engaging in exciting and productive dialogue between experts in healthcare.

Worldwide interconnections are critical as we think global and act local. The advent of PHRs, social network, open platforms, smart phone, personalized medicine, compliance, interoperability, and policies are creating new opportunities for everyone to engage in a dialog to improve care everywhere.

At our local meetups we discuss real-life technology use-cases from hospitals, doctor offices, medical billing, insurance, remote monitoring, pharmaceuticals, health-and-wellness, and various patient-care services. Subject matter experts, users, entrepreneurs, regulators, and providers will address each other's needs and solutions. The objective is to connect entrepreneurs with professionals who are addressing these real-life problems that exist in the healthcare ecosystem. We will review how affordable, scalable, deployable systems can meet or exceeds the needs of 21st century care-giving for everyone.

To learn more, please visit our website: www.healthtechnologyforum.com
results.name: Health Technology Forum: New York City

results.description:
As salamo alaikum, This is a group for Non-Muslims ( curious to learn about islam ), Muslims ( Reverts, Converts and Born Muslims ). The aim of creating this group is to understand Islam in the light of Quran and the teachings of the Holy Prophet(p.b.u.h) and his family, God willing/inshAllah, to gain the pleasure of God and seek nearness to Him. Let's educate ourselves about the beauty of Islam and bring it deeper into our lives. Islam is the religion of knowledge, it is a guide to the straight path from darkness into the light. The first aayah of the Qur’an to be revealed enjoined reading which is the key to knowledge. God/Allah (SWT) says: “Read! In the Name of your Lord Who has created (all that exists). He has created man from a clot (a piece of thick coagulated blood). Read! And your Lord is the Most Generous. Who has taught (the writing) by the pen. He has taught man that which he knew not” [al-‘Alaq 96:1-5] Islam calls us to seek knowledge. The Prophet (PBUH) made seeking knowledge an obligation upon every Muslim. The Prophet of Allah (saaw) was asked: “What is Knowledge?” He replied: “to keep silent”. He was asked: “Then?” He said: “to listen attentively”. He was asked: “Then?” He said: “to remember”. He was asked: “Then?” He said: “to act upon (what is learned)”. He was asked: “Then?” He said: “to propagate”. [Al-Majlisi, Bihar al-Anwar, vol. 2, p. 28] There is no goodness in knowledge which is not confirmed by action, or words which are not confirmed by deeds:Allah says: “O you who believe, why do you say what you do not do? It is most hateful to Allah for you to say what you do not do.” [Sûrah al-Saff: 2-3] So let us learn Islam : the perfect way of life and and bring it into our deeds and actions. May God guide us to straight path/siratal mustaquim ishAllah. Welcome to our group! Please feel free to post any suggestions or comments. May God Bless you/Jazakallah khair !!!

QuranProject.org The website www.quranproject.org was setup to accompany the publication. Here readers would be able to read it all online, download it, order their free copy, and go through the many additional sections including free online library, audio and video etc.

results.description:
Community focused on the Marketplace Lending and Peer to Peer Lending (P2P) space. The goal is to share experiences, advice, and tools for growing this asset class to help shape the very nature of next-generation financial services.

This group was created by Matt Burton, the CEO of Orchard Platform, as a way to develop a community of like minded individuals. Orchard has evolved organically from what began as a small circle of friends with unique perspectives and complementary skill sets, driven by the same interests, and a desire to make a difference in the alternative lending space. Orchard includes experts from both the financial and technology space. 

Orchard is an investment and analytics platform that is leading the future of the credit industry. Orchard supports marketplace lending by providing technical and operational efficiencies to help institutional investors, investment managers and loan originators connect and transact. Founded in New York City in 2013, Orchard focuses on building the systems and infrastructure that will allow marketplace lending to grow into a global financial market. Orchard enables institutional investors to scale their investment in the space by providing investment strategy, real-time execution and reporting, premier analytics, and access to supply. Orchard helps originators expand the credit landscape by connecting them to a diverse set of capital providers, and enables them to focus on making loans and giving borrowers more choices.
results.name: Marketplace Lending (Peer to Peer Lending)

results.description: The New Vision Interspiritual Seminary (NVIS) is the newest of the interfaith seminaries in the New York City area offering a unique program rooted in the energetic truths of the world's religions - one that brings all of these truths together to find the spark of Oneness in all of them. Our seminary is academically substantial and spiritually grounded while adding the dimensions of personal growth and development. This specialized curriculum goes further into understanding and working with the energetic shift of consciousness which is happening right now on our planet. This discussion group will explore from the highest place of positive energy, light and tolerance: what it means to work with the energetic shift of consciousness - deep personal development and advanced spiritual practice in a new and different way - what it means to become a "Universal Human" as spoken about by Barbara Marx Hubbard, Futurist and World Leader - the mystical/energetic aspects of religions along with inner work - interfaith perspective through comparative religions, focusing on compassion, connection with community and the Inner Divine. We welcome all Seekers of Light, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, color, race or creed. We encourage clergy, teachers and leaders from many spiritual paths, as well as psychology and healing professionals to join us. Welcome to a New Paradigm in Interfaith Understanding!
results.name: New Vision Interspiritual Seminary

results.description:
We believe that to create better results in whatever we do….

We need to build better people. And to build better people, we need our business culture to support, encourage and reward the values and behaviors that lead to those results. We come together to learn about individual human dynamics and culture and their effects on building GREAT teams and organizations that, in turn, create GREAT results.

Specifically, we address questions like:

  • What are those values at the individual, team, and organizational levels that produce great software?
  • What behaviors do we want to see? What does a culture look like anyway?
  • How do we deliberately design cultures to produce high performance?

These are the topics we regularly discuss at our meetings. Our speakers come from all walks of life, all around the world, and share their experiences – both good and bad – around these topics.

So, if you are passionate about high performance and want to learn and share – then come join us!
results.name: Agile Culture New York

The Hara Partners Team - “Focus on what you do best”.

results.description:
This meetup is for people who are enthusiastic about capitalism as a system. Libertarians, market-oriented Democrats, Republicans, and Independents are welcome.

This is not a Tea-Party meetup. We do not support "starve the beast" as a political strategy, and feel that should significant tax cuts come, they should be after we have been running a budget surplus for years, sufficient to pay down the national debt to less than 70% of GDP. Tax increases should not be off the table.

This meetup is about economics and politics, but only politics that relate to economics.

Social and religious issues are off-topic unless they relate to economics.

Investment strategies may be discussed, but they are not the central theme of this meetup.

While the soul of this meetup is Libertarian, this is not a Libertarian Party meetup, partly because the US constitution usually dooms 3rd parties to obscurity, and partly because we want to be more pragmatic and less ideologically pure than the Libertarian Party.

Rules for comments:

Comments are to be made only by people who have RSVP'ed to the event..

People who made a habit of RSVP'ing, then making comments, then failing to show up (even if they change their RSVP to "No") will be banned from the meetup group.

Comments are to be short. It is a goal of this meetup that attendees should be able to read everything on an event, including comments, in less than 2 hours. Reading that is linked must be skimmable in 5 minutes, thoroughly readable in 20 minutes. Videos and podcasts are frowned upon as they are not skimmable and must be less than 5 minutes long.

 If you have something to say that is too long to put into an event comment but that would be less than 20 minutes long, you are encouraged to post it to the message board and link to it from an event comment.  An additional advantage of that is that you can post pictures / charts this way.

Postings that violate these guidelines will be deleted by the event host.

Topics we would like to discuss:

    Why did the mortgage meltdown happen -- was it "excessive deregulation", or was it "just a bubble bursting"? If it was a bubble bursting, can regulation prevent bubbles?

    Is it reasonable to expect people in government to be so much smarter than the market that they can accurately perceive bubbles and take corrective measures before the market has figured out that a bubble is happening?

    Ben Bernanke says that the bond market currently overestimates the government's willingness to bail out a big bank in the future, and he says the government now has tools to wind down a large organization that didn't exist in 2008. Should we believe him?

    Some types of regulation are clearly bad. What types of regulation are good?

    Do we need banks that are big enough to pose systemic risk? Or should we impose a "systemic risk tax" to penalize banks for being too big, so that they will voluntarily split themselves into smaller organizations?

    Is growing inequality a problem if poverty is not increasing and median income is not declining?

    Which is the worse sin: greed or envy?

    Incumbents usually want stimulus, while the opposition usually screams bloody murder about the deficit. Should we opt for more stimulus now, or austerity, or are we currently making the right trade off?

    You may love or hate Obamacare, but everyone agrees it won't do anything to contain our country's rampant medical inflation. What should be done to address this problem?

    Economic Liberals, like those who run the Tenement Museum on the LES, often point to conditions in the 19th century and claim "that is where unbridled capitalism would take us". How did people's living conditions in the 19th century compare to their living standards before that? Do we owe our improved standard of living to politicians, union organizers, and regulators, as these people would claim, or to the inventors and industrialists who made dramatic increases in productivity possible?

    Dodd-Frank: pros and cons?

    The cost of college has been increasing much faster than inflation. The "US News and World Report"'s annual ranking of colleges actually rewards schools for spending more money per pupil. Many students are graduating so far in debt they are unlikely be debt-free before they are 30. This whole problem undermines social mobility. Why is this happening and what can be done about it?

    China's gradual adoption of market reforms after the death of Mao and the discrediting of the Soviet economic model around 1990 have made market economics the only game in town. This has brought a flood of good news from economies that 20 years ago were deemed hopeless. Living standards in China and India have increased dramatically, and there are 3 cellphones for every four Africans.
results.name: Fans of Capitalism

results.description:
The process of building software and the way engineering teams are structured to deliver it are going through a process of transformative change. There is probably no clearer example of this than in the world of startup engineering. How else could Instagram have built & operated a system that ran on cross-platform devices and scaled to 30M users with only a small team of engineers? But how are are startup teams like Instragram organized? And what processes do they use to design, deliver and maintain their platforms? 

Drawing on the experience of top startup engineers, this group teaches the core principles of startup engineering. Our talks explore real-world scenarios and tested methodologies that startup engineers will learn from as they work to build their own platforms and the teams that deliver them.
results.name: NYC Startup Engineering

results.description:
This is a group for people either new to New York City, or have called the city home for awhile and are interested in discovering new neighborhoods and learning more about the city's fascinating history, architecture and culture.  Most of our activities are professionally-guided walks of 3 - 5 miles within a NYC neighborhood that has distinct and unique qualities.  They usually last from 2 to 4 hours. We usually have an optional social hour afterwards for a meal and/or a beverage at a local restaurant.  During the summer months we usually combine a walk with a free outdoor concert, often in the evenings.  During the winter we'll have shorter outdoor walks coupled with a museum visit.

I also organize theme tours to add some spice and variety to honor holidays or famous New Yorkers. Afterwards there will usually be an optional socializing for a drink or a meal. Our events are usually free with a voluntary donation of a dollar or two.  When we have museum visits there will be a charge.

I started this group because I am a native New Yorker and have a successful dual career as a professional tour guide and real estate agent, now with the prestigious Corcoran Group. I love to introduce people to new neighborhoods and explore their past, present and future and also welcome the opportunity to learn from others. With the fast-pace of life here it is easy to overlook the hidden treasures and iconic buildings that we pass by every day. I  love Harlem (where I spent my formative years) due its many different areas, amazing history and beautiful architecture. Other favorites include the West Village, Lower Manhattan (where the City's history began), Flatiron/Gramercy, Upper West Side, Brooklyn Heights, Fort Greene/Clinton Hill,the East Village and Washington Heights.
results.name: Exploring NYC History and Neighborhoods

Are you a thought leader, visionary, developer or hacker looking to improve individual and/or community health while reducing the cost of healthcare? results.description:
Welcome, Real Estate Professionals & Investors.

I am changing this group to focus on real estate development. I am a CPA by trade but I decided to learn and trade in real estate after one of the real estate seminar.

The seminar is heavily advertised on radio (at least in NYC) where you get to attend 2 hour demo for free and at the end there is a push for more expensive paid seminars. I opted not to go for the paid seminar however. The only thing I walked away from that seminar: Real Estate related investments have produced more millionaires than any other trade.

Since that seminar, I spent countless hours to put together a plan. Unlike, other investment groups Real Estate will require a complete team of professionals and bunch of investors.

Currently I am looking forward to connect with:

1. Real Estate Brokers (No sales people yet)

2. Mortgage Brokers or bankers.

3. Attorney

4. Contractors (GC, Plumbing, Electricians)

5. If you feel you have passion to join team, you are welcome as well.

I don't really care if you have 20 years experience or just starting out in your field. As long as you are able to come up to the plate and hit a home run, you are welcome. I think it's important that all professionals get their chance instead of being shut out by so called 'Experience'. All we need is 'Can do' attitude, intelligence and some money.

Please join and suggest! Let's all make some $$$.
results.name: New York: Real Estate Professionals & Investors

results.description: There isn't space to put all I want in the title, but I want to create this group for adult children who feel marginalized by their family structure, by one or both parents, or who feel that they have a parent who doesn't understand them, a parent who exhibits extreme favoritism toward a sibling, or a parent who is self-absorbed, selfish, or narcissistic. I want the group to be a private, safe and healthy place to support each other. Humans need to feel connected with others and loved and cared for by others to thrive, and, when we don't get this from our family units, we may suffer. I am not striving to create a group where we aggravate our difficulties by discussing only what's wrong, but where we have a group that feels like home, where we can offer each other coping strategies and encouragement to lead full lives even if we sometimes feel something is missing. I will strive to keep the group as private as possible. For that reason, I am not revealing much personal information unless you join. Thank you for respecting that.
results.name: Adult Children of Narcissists

results.description:
As basic as playing the beautiful game, pick-up soccer, "pelada" -the game played everywhere, by everyone in an organized fun way.

 

Beautiful Game FC was started so we could play pickup soccer and also collect for soccer specific charities. Our first accomplishment – though rather small, was giving a meager sum to the roundstarfoundation.org as two coaches went and set up clinics to coach kids and also teachers who want to lead community teams in Zimbabwe.

We are building our charity work as Beautiful Game grows. So we ask for $2 donations per game to cover our costs.

Meetup is a great website that connects all of us soccer lovers but in case you did not know. It is not free. Meetup charges $45 every 3 months to use it. Simple math= 3 months, goes into 12 months, 4 times. That’s $180 per year to use Meetup.

We also provide top quality gear. We play with 6 foot Pugg nets, cones, a kick-ass (pun intended) FIFA authentic Bola Official ball of Brasil ($150) and not so world class bibs. We hope to get nicer bibs in the future.

We want to keep our current schedule of Mon-Wed-Fri 1pm kickoffs but I'm not able to make it every time as I have coaching scheduling conflicts some days. So Mpande is running the Meetups on the days I can't. And he will set up the pitch so you can all play, but also, he will be collecting. Please don’t make him beg for a dollar. He truly does this for the love of the game, but lugging 6 foot goals on the subway is no fun.

If your attitude is like ‘F*ck this shit no way I’m paying for pickup soccer in NYC!’ that’s cool there are many other soccer Meetup groups. But if you are like I like what they do, but have no job, hence I play soccer in the middle of the day during the work week, and I can’t afford $2- talk to us and that is cool. We understand. It’s all about helping those that could use it. And if you are broke and playing soccer, I call that therapeutic.

Best,

Matt
results.name: Beautiful Game FC

Do you remember playing those joystick arcade games in the 80s and 90s growing up? Waiting your turn in line behind a big arcade game and putting your quarter near the screen? DO, Paperboy, Roadblasters, Zaxxon, Spy hunter, Contra, Centipede, Congo Bongo, Galaza, and QIX. results.description:
Hi everyone,  I hope you'll join us in the practice of being mindful.

Being mindful is simply defined as a process of bringing your attention, in an intentional way, to the present moment with an attitude of openness and acceptance.

Mindfulness is an opportunity to slow down, to embrace the moment, and to develop self-compassion. Learn and practice mindfulness techniques that can be easily incorporated into your daily life. You will learn techniques including: breathwork, guided and unguided meditations and emotional and sensory awareness exercises. And learn habits to help you remember from moment to moment.

From these practices, you will find more clarity of thought, action and emotional responses in yourself and in your relationships with others.  Find out what everyone is talking about and find out more about yourself.
results.name: Mindfulness: a place to be, in Brooklyn

results.description:
NEW YORK SOCIETY OF MIXOLOGY

 

We ameliorate 8 million lively souls, in the most legendary city in the world, with a single sip. Our cocktails crafted with heart and hand. The society is a meet up established for aspiring bartenders, sommliers, flair bartenders, mixologist, and cocktail chefs. Other restaurant professionals are welcome.

 

This community was originally devised as a career support group for bartenders searching for a job in the food and hospitality field. Yet, we want to expand to be a wing-man through your entire evolution. The society offers resources and experiences for you and by you. Each member will find themselves being an enthusiastic and loyal contributor.

 

What could you expect as a member?

 

LABS

 

Hands-on experience resources like guest bartending and educational workshops to help you grow as professional.

 

STUDIES

 

tudy Groups to get feedback on your resume, interview skills, and job search strategy. Additionally, we'll keep you abreast with your mental cocktail Rolodex. So you'll never have to go fishing for the cocktail book when some one ask for Pisco Sour. Gush over collectively esteemed 'book of the month" that is related to enriching ourselves as professionals and/or human beings.

 

MIXERS

 

Bond with pros just like you while you savor refreshments . We'll have discussions on hot topics at the forefront of the community's mind, give away loot, enjoy entertainment, and/or chitchat our phenomenal guest speakers.

 

WALKS

 

Job seekers will benefit from group job search efforts. Some establishments may not advertise their vacant positions because they expect walk-ins. We will walk to various neighborhoods to accomplish that.

 

TOURS

 

Join us for group outings to distilleries, venues, breweries, wineries, related educational organizations, food and drink festivals locally and abroad.

 

HOPS

 

Bar hops, wine bars, restaurants, and private parties at lounges! Titillating cocktails at the Oral Fix bar, reservations at Please Don't Tell, sip South African Sauvignon Blanc at Ardesia and "Hell Yeah, We want fries with that!" at Saxon +Parole. We'll explore the best city has to offer and the hidden treasures of New York. We'll picked the brains of the most respected bartenders of our time.

 

So pull up a stool, and stay awhile. We're family now.
results.name: The New York Society of Mixology

We need to keep Meetup members in the platform- that means that once they arrive to meetup.com, a group page or open the apps, they need to register, then we need to make sure they join at least one group and RSVP.

Once they RSVP, we need to make sure they continue to RSVP, either by altering them of upcoming Meetups, and suggesting new Meetup groups and events.

Aiming to combine Spirituality and Arts (expression) consciously and bring back to daily New York Life. Non-verbal setting makes easier to communicate to other beings from inner truth and this can be a good bridge to merge your natural spaciousness and socialization.
results.name: Silent Party with Spirit & Art

results.description:
They call me The Curl Whisperer. I am a licensed stylist born and bred in the Mecca of Natural Hair, Brooklyn. You can see me in my natural hair workshops, seminars and events!

It's all in the hands and product you use. Come out and I will show you how to work it Brooklyn style. See you at the next Meetup!

*If you would like to suggest a MeetUp, please contact me first. The MeetUps in this group are events that I am attending.
results.name: Jaded Tresses - Transform Your Natural Hair!

results.description:
Calling people who are: Fun, Vivacious and Effervescent about life and love to travel and explore NJ as if you haven’t lived here your whole life. Lets geek out and go for tours, or go wander around a town you have never visited …snow tubing, river tubing …anything that does not require a lot of skill, but is fun :)

We are looking to expand our group with some fun loving, funny, great people! Age is really just a number…but it would be nice to have group in their 20's to 40's. And it would be a major perk if you happen to live in the 732 area code. If not, hey...it’s worth traveling to meet good people. Girls, guys…the more the merrier, lets plan some cool stuff!

New Members are ALWAYS WELCOME at ANY Meet up event we host. We do not wait for certain events...our group is your group. We are a welcoming bunch xoxox

If you don’t see an event posted that works for you and you would like to host an event, just contact the organizer with details.

This is a group geared towards singles, but please don’t let that deter you! This is NOT a dating group. This is NOT a group that is about finding your soul mate. This IS a group about getting together with people who want to go out and have a great time. This group offers us the opportunity to enjoy the things we love with other likeminded people.

From time to time, you may see LMMU (last minute meet up) or what this group has coined as a "post and go". This is when an organizer finds free time and wants to get a group together fast- this can be a great way to meet some of the group in small doses. But if many people is what you prefer, then that is awesome too!

We can be your Wing-men/Wing-women...how great it is to know you can go hang out somewhere and already have a crew to hang out with? Let's help each other, and have a great time all at the same time.

Groups are not about numbers, but engagement - actually coming out, being part of us, ya know? It's easy to sit at a computer and watch life pass you by, maybe a small investment will keep someone from joining if they really don't plan on meeting up w/ meet up :) (the whole point, btw)

Meet up charges the organizer of meet up groups $90.00 every 6 months. Member dues will help pay for organizer dues, as well as hopefully help get all members out with the group/more engaged and participating. Be proud you are here in Jersey's 732, be proud you are single, and most importantly, get out and LIVE!

We also accept offers of sponsorship, please contact Dion, Dawn, Heather, or any "732" Leader/Organizer/Event Organizer, etc. for more information. Please know the incentive you would be willing to offer the group.

Many members have asked how they can tell people about the group quickly - just tell them to Google the following - Single in the 732 and we will pop up. Or, our brand new quick link: http://www.meetup.com/732peeps/ 

***IMPORTANT INFORMATION*** liability and release

By signing up as a member of the "30 & 40 Something Single Peeps in the "732" and/or attending an event,(as a member, guest or minor) you and your guests or minors (if applicable) accept and fully understand and will adhere to the fact that any event can come with risk and/or harm, and you fully assume all risks associated with such participation, including travel to and from the event.  You agree to be responsible for your own safety and equipment; and realize that waterway conditions, obstacles, weather, your own skill level, and even peoples personalities, choices, and tolerance levels can change at any time. You and any guest(s), minor(s) etc., agree to hold all Organizers and/or Sponsors harmless in the event of the following, but not limited to, equipment or vehicle loss or damage, emotional stress,  job loss, driving or licensing (of any kind) loss, injury or death.

Know when to say when regarding any consumption of alcohol and all interpersonal connections, both friendly, business related and/or romantic/sexual involvement.  You agree to be self protecting, and self aware, as background checks are not run on members of meet-up.

Drug use, sale, or dispensation of any kind is not allowed within this group.

Update : July 2015 - Would like to work on more sponsorships.. the more followers the easier that will be for us to bring in $ for free drinks and food. 

Please follow/like us on our new pages via Facebook and also google plus:

https://plus.google.com/u/0/b/1005150945965... 

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Seventhreetwo-Peeps/691659957570628 

Group was founded by "D-Roc" April of 2013, and first Meetup occurred June of 2013. In the words from our "Godfather"(mother's) favorite singer she wants us to "Measure up our wealth in friends and family".
results.name: 20-40 Something Peeps of the "732"

results.description:
This group is for data hackers, scientists, analysts, statisticians, engineers, enthusiasts, gurus, ninjas, wizards - whatever your preferred label, if you possess hands-on experience with data and use it to solve problems, then this group is for you.

We'll cover a wide range of data topics, mostly those relevant to the tech industry: prediction, visualization, data cleaning, real-time reporting, user tracking, split testing, etc...

The group is language agnostic but will emphasize ubiquitous/open-source tools.

We will learn from each other through small discussions, workshops, lightning talks, and unconferences. Email if you're interested in presenting!
results.name: NY Data Wizards

results.description: Interested in using your tech skills for good? We host meetups to cover the tech skills required to make a difference to the world. We'll be covering topics such as Product Development, Creating MVPs, Open-Source Dev and Web Development.
results.name: Tech For Good NYC

results.description: We're passionate about media innovation and discussing how it's produced and distributed. We examine how the content, the platform/network, and the entire user experience is designed to support the media's intention, be it to inform, educate, persuade, or entertain.
results.name: Content Lab

results.description: This group is for gay men who are enthusiastic about road cycling, who would like to road bike with and get to meet other like-minded people. All skill levels are welcome, but participants are expected to have a multispeed road bike, or a hybrid bike for the easier rides. Rides will be categorized in a similar manner to the big cycling groups (NYCC etc..) so you can know in advance what is the level of the ride and what to expect. Ideally each ride will include one (or more) rest stops in the middle to eat, drink and most importantly socialize. I am looking forward to having great cycling trips together!
results.name: The NYC Gay Men Road Cyclists Meetup

results.description:
Welcome to The Activity Group 45+NYC and Tourist.

This group  was created to provide  New Yorkers and Tourist , opportunities to participate in the cultural and artistic life of the city and beyond. This group is for fun loving ,active people like you.

Activities/Events--- Concerts, Broadway, Off Broadway, Museum Tours, Day Trips, Shopping, Parks, Casinos , Tours,Travel etc.

Activities are offered frequently. Most Events will be FREE or LOW COST.

................................................................................

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN THIS GROUP?

1) You  would like to meet new and interesting people..............

2)You would like to get out more.....

3)You would like to go out with people your own age....

4)You feel isolated and need others to talk to.....

5)You have  lots of ideas for events......

6) You  would like to share your happiness with others....

7) You like to save money on events....

8)You're new to New York......

9)You're Retired and would like to stay active.....

10)You 're a Tourist and would like to see  other  interesting locations...

WHATEVER YOUR REASON, PLEASE  SIGN UP AND JOIN THIS GROUP TODAY. I CAN'T  WAIT TO HAVE YOU AS A MEMBER.

MEMBERSHIP DUES: $10.00 per year.

Please note: Due to the cost of organizing the group, a small Annual Membership Dues of $10.00  are required from all members. This fee  is a contribution towards the monthly fee to Meetup.com and for other cost associated with organizing  events.

 (ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP DUES ARE PAID ONCE PER YEAR AT YOUR 1ST EVENT).

PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS  A  14 DAYS TRIAL PERIOD FOR ALL NEW MEMBERS. AFTER THE TRIAL PERIOD, IF YOU DON'T  SUBMIT YOUR ANNUAL DUES, YOU'LL BE REMOVED FROM THE GROUP.


PLEASE JOIN TODAY!

Best regards

Laurel
results.name: THE ACTIVITY  GROUP  45+ NYC

results.description:
We are the career chasers, the changemakers, the entrepreneurs, the ambitious multitaskers....basically we are the ones either making things happen or on our way. However, in our busy lives, it's important not to forget about our health. Who doesn't want to be healthy? So this is the group for you to hit 2 birds with 1 stone!

Here we create a community for professional networking to not only share ideas, create commerce and success together in business, but also to create a community to share ideas on health, nutrition, and fitness. Who has time to sit there all day, read a billion books on health & nutrition, and sort through their validity? (By the way if you are that person, then that's great too). Since most of us don't, we should just bounce ideas off each other. The good news is amongst the variety of professionals in the group, we already have some healthcare/fitness professionals in this group. The better news is we welcome more, and if you're not one, then that's why you should join.

We will have a variety of meetups such as happy hour networking, different physical activities such as yoga, running, rock climbing, to social activities such as bowling, paint balling, bbq's, and even doing health challenges. And of course, we are always open to feedback because there is always room for improvement.
results.name: Healthy Lifestyle for Busy Professionals

results.description: This meetup group is intended to bring together bioinformatics software developers, life scientists and entrepreneurs interested on the applications of cloud computing to the analysis of large-scale genome sequencing datasets. We welcome members from academia, non-profits or industry, who would like to discuss research ideas, software, explore ventures in cloud computing / genome sequencing technologies, or simply build a network with others that are enthusiastic for the potential offered by the intersection of these two technologies.
results.name: Bioinformatics and Cloud Computing NYC

results.description:
Middle Eastern Tech Entrepreneurs is a group of visionary Middle Eastern technologist who are actively working or looking to create their own startup and want to find a place to harvest connections, and gain experience from established serial entrepreneurs as well as leaders in the financial and business world.

The group is also open for anyone who wants to expand his technology to the untapped Middle Eastern echosystem and would like to learn the best way to penetrate the market.

As the tech scene in the Middle East starts to boom, many organizations launched initiatives to harvest young entrepreneurs and provide the support needed to grow the next generation of visionaries and market leaders. METE provides a bridge between the US, Canada and the middle east by funneling members through a channel of mentoring and support to school them in their business idea and expose them to possible investors or strategic partners.


Q- Do i have to be Middle Eastern to join the group?
 A- No. Everyone is welcomed to join.

Q- I do not have a tech startup, can i join the group?
 A- Yes. You can get a lot from the group by networking with other like minded people, learn about the tech echo-system in the US vs the ME and possibly join a future company or find a co-founder.

Q- I would like to become a group sponsor or supporter, who do i contact?
 A- You can contact one of the group organizers listed on the left column of the meetup group.
results.name: Middle Eastern Tech Entrepreneurs

results.description:
3 Hour Seminars addressing all phase of the music business including A&R, Bookings, Publishing, Branding, Psychology of Music, Music Production and much more.

Each seminar is moderated by Gold and Platinum Music Producer and former head of A&R for EMI Music group, John McCracken.

Each seminar will have an industry veteran guest speaker experienced in each of these areas.

This is an open forum of Q&A and a great way to network with like minded musicians.
results.name: Autonomy Music

results.description:
A Tribe Called Love [for NYC Couples]

Calling all 20 something and 30 something, committed couples in NYC! This group is for those of you who still love to get out and have fun while meeting other great couples and strengthening your relationship at the same time.

We believe that dating doesn't have to stop after dating! Too often, date night is the first thing to go out the window when couples settle down and get comfortable. We're here to help NYC couples keep date night fresh, fun and exciting!

Our goal is to host at least two MeetUps a month. And although we already have a growing queue of activities for the next few months, we definitely encourage suggestions from you guys. We want to make sure you guys are all getting the best experience you can from this group, so don't be shy.

Go ahead and hit that Join button and let's have a good time!
results.name: A Tribe Called Love [for Couples]

results.description: This is a group for Trust & Safety and Policy pros on the NYC tech scene. We meet every 2-3 months to discuss different approaches to community management, privacy policies, policy development and enforcement, marketplace integrity, moderating user-generated content, data security, spam, wrangling member squabbles, etc.

results.description: This one time 'meetup' event is a three day program of energetic transmissions, expansion and learning. In the Soul Empowerment event we shall gain specific information and skills for deep soul navigation. This will illuminate your unique paths to practical self mastery.

results.description:
The purpose of this group is to bring together local like minded serious Connecticut and Westchester people (and surrounding areas) who are looking to expand their social circles, make new friends, and possibly more.  Some of the events are affiliated with Weekenddating, while others are and hosted by community meetup organizers .  Our events aim to foster in person connections amoung people who may have never met otherwise.    Some of the event types we offer are :  bowling, pool, golf, bingo, shows, rock climbing, museums, baseball games, concerts, mingles and more. 

We are NOT a dating service, but rather event organizers who plan IN PERSON fun events and have a goal to help you meet new people. 

Please feel free to call me with any questions.

Warm regards,

Jay

718-757-6933

topics.name: Accent Modification, Non Native English Speakers

results.description:
This is a group for anyone who wants to learn how to produce the sounds that make up an accent. Actors auditioning for accent roles are welcome, as well as comedians who want to add credibility to their acts. If you've ever wanted to learn how to do any accent, we'd love to help! We will meet once a month for two hours in a fun and informal setting. Bring a pen and paper, and the three accents you'd like to learn. Think of it like a party at the United Nations!

 

Group and private coaching is also available, but these Meetups are completely free of charge, other than to cover the cost of the space.
results.name: Accent Workshop for Actors, Comedians, and everyone else!

results.description: Do you run web sites on IIS, .NET (or Mono) and Microsoft Windows Server? Do you use Windows PowerShell to manage your Infrastructure. Do you spin up Microsoft Windows cloud instances on Windows Azure, EC2 or RackSpace? Microsoft shops that run Web Sites face the same problems with configuration management, deployment and operations as folks that run on the LAMP stack. This community will teach each other good practices with running web sites on Microsoft Windows, IIS and .NET from OS provisioning to monitoring and operations
results.name: NYC WebOps on Windows

results.description:
Are you searching for fun and uplifting activities that will support your health, happiness, and well-being? Have you tried different doctors, practitioners, or therapies that didn't seem to work for you? Are you afraid to try something new, unsure if it's going to work or don't know enough about it? Are you seeking inspiration and help on your healing journey? Are you looking to meet others that share your interests and support you along the way?

The Community of Healing is about bringing those together who are seeking Emotional, Physical, & Spiritual Healing. Our goal is to introduce and educate you on different healing modalities so you can find what resonates with you on your own healing journey. Together we can explore different pathways of Healing.

Join us for events that nourish the mind, body, and spirit. Events will include: Meditation, Introductions to different Healing modalities, Nature walks/hiking, drum circles, dance, Reiki and Energy work, Yoga, Volunteering, Nutrition, Comedy shows and Motivational movies.

All ages are welcome. Some events will be gender specific and will be noted.

Let's heal ourselves and help support each other!!!

Quote: “We're all just walking each other home.” - Ram Dass :-)
results.name: THE COMMUNITY OF HEALING NJ/NY/PA

results.description:
(Attention)-When first signing up for ID purpose please provide a photo of yourself in your profile thank you. We are a social group of cyclists who enjoy the company of others riding together along the many miles of safe roads and trails available in the Bronx,Westchester and Putnam and Dutchess County and beyond. 

We offer rides at all levels, from the beginner’s level to the advance +level 

We will have bike tours every now and then on a weekend throughout the season 

We will also post after work rides: (we called it ride and eat rides) in the summer. 

With weather permitting we post a average of two to three events a week including weekends.   

The group will have a beginning of the season get together and an end of the season get together.

We, each, individually challenge ourselves to keep a competitive pace, recognizing a diversity of limits, and still take time to stop and smell the roses. Most all events allow for time to socialize, and grab a bite to eat, and encourage the bond that comes with riding together.

We are not a professional organization, just a group of like minded individuals who share an interest in cycling.  When you RSVP YES for an event, you agree to be responsible for your own safety and your guest, including your own equipment, and hold no one else liable for any accident, injury or event.

For great inspiration and a taste of how much  we love cycling and want you to love it too, see this amazing introduction by Tom: http://www.meetup.com/Westchester-Social-Cycling/messages/boards/thread/26306702
results.name: The City Island & Orchard Beach Cycle Club
results.who: Cycle and stay young and healthy

Welcome to Let's Read Chamber Music Group. This Meetup Group is to create an opportunity for BOTH professionals and amateur music lovers to share music and socialize.

Please don't be intimidated if you are not ready to be on the Carnegie Hall this afternoon. I also ask professional musicians not to discriminate non-professionals. They are the future of classical music. It is our responsibility to continue to keep their interest and support in our art form.

Hope to see you and to make music with you soon!

Yoon Lee

results.description: If you're a professional Bachelor or Bachelorette between the ages of 25 - 60 and open to interracial dating then this is the group to join. This is a heterosexual group for singles who are interested in looking for dating and relationships in the boroughs of Queens, Brooklyn, and Manhattan. I will be hosting Meetups so you can have a chance to fine that special someone or make new friends. They will take place at different classy venues. Join us... and have a chance to meet that special someone. This group is for people who are open to dating out of their race and also dating within their race.. Black, White, Indian, Asian, and, Hispanic..all races....Basically no discrimination...Looking to meet some great people...so join me and we can have fun together and make this a successful group. This is a Singles Only group. Serious Members Apply.
