topics.name: Night Life, Social, Movies, Fun & Games Night
Dining Out, BBQs, Food Fairs, Happy Hour and More

results.description:
LIFE IS AN ECHO. What you send out – comes back. What you sow – you reap. What you give – you get. What you see in others – exists in you. Do not judge – so you will NOT be judged. Radiate and give LOVE – and Love comes back to you. ~ Zig Ziglar

It's not happy people who are thankful, it is thankful people who are happy. ~ Unknown

What is LIFE OUT LOUD?

Our philosophy is simple ... be positive, inclusive, supportive and really enjoy the moments and memories we are building together.

Life is too short NOT to meet new people, make new friends, do something different, scream at the top of your lungs for no reason, commit random acts of kindness just for a smile and REALLY enjoy all that you do. In our group, you will meet and make new friends; you may eat a type of food you have never even heard of before; you could spend a day hiking in the beautiful wooded countryside (or maybe even do that same hike at night under a full moon); you can learn more about the New York Tri-State area through a tour or two; you will feel good about yourself when you help others at our volunteer events; you might learn to meditate, do yoga or tai chi; you can even face your fears with your new friends on exciting, adrenaline pumping adventures.

We are a group of open-minded, fun, positive, friendly, respectful, and supportive people who come from all walks of life.  No matter what your background, we want to meet you.  We want you to meet each other. We all have value as human beings, so let’s share that value with one another. The more diverse our group is, the more fun we will all have!!

So, read the rest, check out and agree to the Legal Disclaimer and Policies, and then join us to make new, lasting friendships and live LIFE OUT LOUD!

Who Are The Organizers:

There is no one organizer of LOL.  The group is run as a committee.  The LOL Organizers are friends that know, care about, and trust each other. We all endeavor to welcome you with open arms and come to know and care about YOU as much as we do for one another.  All the organizers and hosts have a shared vision for this group and share a desire to make new friends and provide an awesome time for everyone that comes to the events.   But, we all maintain that the strength of the group is YOU, the members!!

Our Events:

We do events throughout the five boroughs of New York City and beyond.  Our events range from a simple walk in the park, to flying through a canopy of trees on a zipline, to trying out new cuisines, to walking through the streets as a zombie and much more.  We may even spend an entire weekend away, either hiking/camping or going on a getaway.  The events will range in the number of attendees allowed, dependent upon what type of event.  If the event will involve alcoholic beverages, you must be 21 or older to RSVP to that event.

Don't worry about coming out alone, that's what most of us have done and do ... we'll make sure that you feel welcome, have fun and hopefully go home having had a memorable time. You can get started by browsing our Past Events and checking Our Calendar for upcoming events.

PLEASE READ AND AGREE TO OUR LEGAL DISCLAIMER AND POLICIES IN THE PAGES SECTION BEFORE SIGNING UP.
results.name: ! Life Out Loud !

topics.name: Enhancing the Lives of our Pets and Other Pets
fun times- good meals- and new friends!

results.description:
We are a Pet-Friendly Group of Men & Women who wish to reach out to make new friends.  Let's exchange stories, ideas, info, and be there to support each other.  Either you've had a pet in the past, have one now, or are planning to get one in the future.

We will attend Pet Expos, Fundraising Events, Volunteering, the Zoo, and Aquariums, as well as other pet themed outings.     

People w/ pets are trustworthy, loving, responsible, friendly, kind, have knowledge to share, & can help out each other--by their past experiences or professional background, etc.  Let's all come together & meetup!

Thank you for joining us, and 'Welcome!'  :-)
results.name: FRIENDS & PETS IN NASSAU AND BEYOND!

results.description:
“I am a lover of what is, not because I'm a spiritual person, but because it hurts when I argue with reality.” ― Byron Katie, Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life"
The work is a simple and powerful  way of self inquiry that transforms stress, conflict and irritation into peace, love and connection. Please join us and fill your heart with love and compassion.

The group is led by Olga Berg, Certified Facilitator of The Work www.olgaberg.me

results.description:
The New Jersey iPad and iPhone Users Group is long gone. We continue as part of our parent group:

The New Jersey Macintosh Users Group (http://www.meetup.com/NJMacUsersGroup/), which has been meeting monthly since it was founded in 1984. NJMUG is an officially recognized Apple User Group and focuses on discussions and learning about all things Apple - Macintosh computers, iPads, iPhones, Apple Watches, etc. 

So if you're looking to learn more about how to use or make better use of your iPad, iPhone, Macintosh or Apple Watch then sign up and join with us today or visit our full website at http://www.njmug.org ! Our meetings are fun, friendly, and a great source of information. I look forward to meeting you at one of our meetings!
results.name: New Jersey iPad & iPhone Users Group

results.description:
A group for NYC Web Ops engineers, Sysadmins & other Engineers to sit, drink and swap war stories, compare current headaches, and share ideas. Non-opsy-technicals only welcome from the monthly sponsoring company. ;) 

In order for us to accept your join request, please make sure to include some brief information about your interest in ops or your sysadmin background—we are keeping this a safe space for people in our field—thanks for understanding!
results.name: Sysdrink

results.description:
This group is for people who enjoy playing acoustic guitar, other acoustic instruments,  and sing in a casual setting.   It's a great chance to learn some new songs and techniques and make some friends.  People who sing but don't play a musical instrument are welcome to join.

The genre of music ranges from contemporary to classic rock, pop, alternative, and R&B.  You should like to play covers from the Beatles, Neil Young, Coldplay, Radiohead, Rolling Stones, U2, Foo Fighters to name a few.  We have some great songs for male and female vocalists.

The group meets at parks in Manhattan, typically downtown. When it gets cold we move to an indoor location.  We usually play in small groups of 5 - 20 musicians, which allows everyone to participate.  There are song lists posted on our meetup site and we encourage everyone to practice them, print them out, and bring them to the jams.  Don't forget to bring your guitar straps, capos, picks, and a music stand if you have one.

You can also follow us on facebook at NYC-Acoustic-Guitar-Jam-in-the-Park/209685472536700 by liking us there.
results.name: NYC Acoustic Guitar Players and Singers of Manhattan

results.description:
This group exists to strengthen the outdoor community in New York City.

If you organize events in the city aimed at the outdoor community, own or work for a business in the industry, or are working on a side project with the outdoor community, then join this group to network!

Is there something that you've always wanted to Organize, but never had the resources or venue to do so? Then let’s get together and talk!

Joining this Organizer Meetup Group will not only give you a chance to network with leaders in New York City, but also give you an opportunity to cross promote your events in our yearly Outdoor Rise festival and grow your group’s membership. It will give you a chance to share your knowledge and help improve our community as well.

results.description:
Total 3D Experience

3D Printing New York is for anyone interested in the revolutionary 3D technology.

Whether you are:

    a novice and would love to see a 3D printer in action,

    owner of a 3D Printer and keen to show off your creations and share your experience,

Join our group for Demonstrations, Talks, Informal get togethers and other Events.

topics.name: Executive and business coaching and mentoring

results.description: Coaches Unite!! Calling all Coaches...Business Coaches, Executive Coaches, Life Coaches and Niche Coaches. According to the 2012 ICF Global Coaching Study by Price Waterhouse Coopers: 47% of coaches collaborate, 31% barter coaching services, 54% of coaches at all stages offer pro bono coaching. So how will we form Alliances...simply...lets get to know one another. We can all be encouraged, learn and grow from one another. Network events, Coaching Circles ie. Coaching eachother (think ICF credentialing hours or enhancing your craft by learning from others), sharing some of your experiences in the marketplace (Brainstorming) and let's work in some FUN (travel, cocktails, etc)!! And if they moon and stars are aligned properly I may be able to get us a Guest Speaker. Let's build great practices, let's be the best we can be let's develop strategic alliances and let's grow our NYC Coaching Community!!!

We create opportunities for entrepreneurs and aspiring entrepreneurs to network, learn, connect and collaborate. We invite everyone to be a part of the vibrant entrepreneurial culture that is thriving in New Jersey. Lang (Catalyst), Kathleen Coviello (NJ EDA), Caren Franzini (formerly NJ EDA), Fran Hauser (Rothenberg Ventures), Joan Zief (Golden Seeds), Mikki Taylor (Essence Magazine), Gloria Feldt (Take the Lead), Jules Pieri (The Grommet), Zak Cassady-Dorion (Crowdfund Capital Advisors), Jonathan Sandlund (CrowdCafe.com), Kim Wales (Wales Capital and CFIRA board member), Douglas S. Ellenoff (Ellenoff Grossman & Schole LLP), Daryl Bryant (StartupValley.com). Our Meetups are held in Montclair, N.J., and include networking, a startup pitch, and 1-2 brief presentations from featured speakers. Meetups organized by the Feliciano Center for Entrepreneurship at Montclair State University.

We also host some of the region's top events at the intersection of tech and entrepreneurship, including New Jersey's only Google I/O Extended event in 2015 and 2014, through a partnership with the Google Developers Group of North Jersey.

We are in the process of creating a 3D design and printing lab - one of the largest university-based 3D printing facilities in the U.S. and one of the first housed in a school of business - that will include scores of 3D printers and several 3D scanners, and will offer rapid prototyping services for students plus the region's small and midsized manufacturing companies. We plan to hold a series of workshops so community members - in our Meetup group and beyond - can learn 3D design and printing.

Please join us if you’re an entrepreneur, aspiring entrepreneur, interested investor, or a service provider who caters to entrepreneurs.

We get together every week to play dodgeball - and then head out to our sponsor bar for drink deals and bar games.  And it's FREE for new people! And you should probably come do that too, wouldn't you say?! Coed, social sports: shenanigans, tomfoolery, ballyhoo, and general smiley good time funsies all around!

Looking forward to getting to know some fresh faces, meeting good people, and playing with some new folk play in our upcoming season!

Why would you NOT want to run around like a kid, make friends, and have a beer? Inconceivable!


_____________

THE SKINNY:

Old school playground dodgeball is back! Just like Mr. Jameson's 3rd grade gym class - but this time, instead of going back to math class, eating mom's PB&J, and worrying about cooties - you get to go back to a bar, and drink beer, and maybe flirt with people. Better.

We do play each other hard. Because it's fun. And fun's our favorite. Scraped knees are cool.

We do not play each other angry. Because it's dodgeball. You're not a baller. You're playing a children's game.  No one's out there to hurt anyone or being a hothead or we just don't let them play.

So come for the dodging. Stay for the drinking.

Everyone is welcome! Bring your brother! Bring your girlfriend! Bring that coworker you think is cute and want an excuse to hang out with! Bring your mom and her PB&J sandwiches!

topics.name: Bible Study in a Relaxed Atmosphere

results.description:
Are you getting bored of sticking to blind faith? Are your questions always met with abstract and hyberbolic answers?
Do you think organized religion stifles your reasoning powers?
What do the Scriptures say?
'Come now, and let us reason together, saith the LORD' (Isaiah 1:18).
Possibly the only religious book in the world that openly invites its reader to reasoning!
Join our bible study group that gladly accepts God's invitation to reason with Him and study His Word diligently!

Topics the group hopes to explore:
1. What does mankind's future look like, as per the Bible?
2. Why does God permit so much evil in the world?
3. Are science and faith mutually exclusive? Could they be reconciled with each other?
4. What has happened over 2000 years of church history and how has that changed Christianity from its original version?
5. Can the Bible be harmonized from Genesis to Revelation? Does it contradict itself anywhere?

Locations:
We meet at both New York (Manhattan) and New Jersey (Hoboken) locations. We are also open to schedule studies in other towns or suburbs in NY and NJ.

Hallmarks of the group:
1. Informal and interactive study
2. Freedom of thought and open mindedness
3. Intellectually stimulating discussions based on the Scriptures
4. No shackles of any organized religion's dogma
5. Dignified and respectful of each other's opinions
results.name: Bible Study on Deeper Questions

results.description:
Join us if you are ready to make changes in your life for the better, or perhaps just wondering if it's even possible for you or someone you care about to make important changes.

Techniques I share for FREE are easy for even toddlers to learn and use. Come to these meetups to learn how you can help yourself and others by knocking out the anxiety that underpins habits that damage our minds and bodies. You will learn to tap acupuncture points on your face, hands and body to instantly collapse panic attacks, overwhelming negative feelings, and self-sabotaging beliefs. You don't need to talk about that abusive event you survived. You don't need to re-live a disaster. Tapping works on the sub-verbal level, which is why it also works on people who cannot communicate (maybe because of a language barrier -- or maybe they're in a coma). Tapping works on infants and animals too. Sounds too good to be true? Join this group. Skeptics are my favorite people to work with because they keep me honest and are my strongest supporters when they experience this form of healing for themselves.

results.description:
Business-building through relationship-building

Welcome to the NJ Business Owners Mastermind Group!

As entrepreneurs, we *are* our businesses and we are *more* than just business. We want to get to know people better before doing business with them or referring them business. We want to connect people we know with others we know so that they can find what they need. We want to help each other succeed.

This Community is for you if you:

• don’t really like networking events

• desire fewer, deeper conversations to initially get to know someone

• are very busy and find it hard to find the time to meet with people after a networking event

• skip networking meetings of groups you are already a member

• believe in helping others grow their business

• feel frustrated with the noise and distraction that can come with other networking venues

• are a member of other organizations but aren’t finding the business-building support you want

• have felt like you don’t “fit in” at other networking groups you’ve tried

Community Guidelines:

• Business cards are given upon request - not passed out like a poker hand.  :0)

• Help us know WHO you are and what you need (not only what you do) – this gathering is business building through needs discussions

• No annual membership – if you find value here, you will come back because you want to

This Community is *not* for you if you:

• are here to only solicit for clients/customers/team members

• aren’t interested in helping and referring community members

• are judgmental of others or closed-minded to unique business offerings

This group isn't your typical 'networking' event.  We are building business through building relationships, so our focus is spending time getting to know each other and our businesses better - so we can help each other succeed.


Here is an example of a typical Mastermind meeting:

5:30pm – Open mix and mingle (15 minutes)

5:45-6:30pm – Mastermind: 4-5 individuals at about 8 minutes each (45 minutes)

6:30-6:45pm – Connection/Business needs requests (15 minutes)

6:45-7:00pm - Open networking (will sometimes go past 7pm if space allows)

It's a 'smallish' event with between 4-12 in attendance, so we have the time and environment to get to know each other.  Plus, it's relaxed and enjoyable, so join us!

Attendance costs $5 - you can pay here in Meetup when registering - or pay at the door.  We ask that you RSVP in advance, as we don't want to turn anyone away due to our space constraints.  We only have 12 chairs, so come early!
results.name: NJ Business Owners Mastermind Group

El Centro de Educación de Trabajadores has been serving the Hell's Kitchen community since 1975. Through evening education programs, community organizing and cultural events, we help students learn new languages and participate in an exciting cultural exchange. Classes are offered in Spanish, English and Mandarin. We also offer a free Intercambio (English/Spanish language exchange) class Tuesday evenings. An all-volunteer teaching and administrative staff makes classes available at low cost. Our teachers are Native speakers and bring both a passion for teaching and a love of language into every classroom. We are located at Hartley House, a Community Center and Settlement House, serving the Clinton and Hell’s Kitchen neighborhoods since 1897.

Our classes are not wheelchair accessible. They are located on the 2nd-4th floors of a building without an elevator.

Harness the power of the internet to make a great living on your own terms. This is a group for people with a digital art product to sell such as vector illustration, ebooks and apps, digital photography, vector based graphic design, print on demand framed prints and cards, print on demand products and art licensing.

Please bring your illustration work, apps or URLs to share. Bring any relevant articles you wish to discuss. Space is limited to the first 8 people to RSVP. Suggested donation is $3. You are not obligated to donate but it is greatly appreciated since I pay a fee to have the meet up group and I serve coffee and tea at the meetings. Feel free to bring snacks to share or bring a beer for yourself if you like.

Learn how to

Earn money while you sleep or while you’re sick • Copyright your work and keep the copyright of your work • Build a retirement income • Leverage your art or illustrations and sell them over and over in multiple venues • Learn about microstock and art licensing • Learn about print-on-demand products • Learn about selling art on Etsy and Ebay • Learn how to illustrate and publish your own books and ebooks • Learn how to design and animate apps and games without a programmer

Learn about

crowdsourcing, cloud computing, social networking and marketing, blogging, content creation on youtube, microstock, niche websites, ebay, google, adsense, art licensing, street art, toys & games, guerilla marketing and more!

Who Should Attend?

digital illustrators, graphic designers and digital photographers who:

• want to take control of their creativity • have achieved success in traditional graphic arts and want to take it to the next level • are self employed and want to broaden their market and achieve stability • have the desire and inspiration to make this year extraordinary • want a supportive team of exciting creative partners • want to reach or exceed their goals • are ready to let their desire to be passionate about their life and work overcome their fear of change

Please note we meet on the third floor of a walkup building with no elevator. There are no cats or dogs here if you are allergic.

This meeting is free but space is limited so please RSVP. If you RSVP "YES" and find you can't make it after all please change your RSVP to "NO" in case we have a waiting list so someone else can have your reserved spot. I will email people who have successfully RSVPed YES the exact address a few days before the meetup.

results.description:
The hype surrounding Big Data and Data Science is at a fever pitch with promises to solve the world's business and social problems, large and small. How accurate or misleading is this message? How is it helping or damaging people, and which people? What opportunities exist for data nerds and entrepreneurs that examine the larger issues with a skeptical view?

This Meetup focuses on mathematical, ethical, and business aspects of data from a skeptical perspective. Guest speakers will discuss the misuse of and best practices with data, common mistakes people make with data and ways to avoid them, how to deal with intentional gaming and politics surrounding mathematical modeling, and taking into account the feedback loops and wider consequences of modeling. We will take deep dives into models in the fields of Data Science, statistics, finance, economics, healthcare, and public policy.

This is an independent forum and open to anyone sharing an interest in the larger use of data. Technical aspects will be discussed, but attendees do not need to have a technical background.
results.name: Data Skeptics

results.description:
Though it doesn’t sound like it, WorldChoiceModels (WCM) is all about photography! 

WorldChoiceModels is where models take charge and host events for photographers in a variety of themes at various locations: Bridal shoots, engagement shoots, portraits, fashion, action, sport, lifestyle, commercial branding, etc. Photographers are welcome to request themes for the event. Mary Poppins anyone?  

Generally, events are limited to 4 photographers. Most models seem to prefer 3 photographers or less.  

There will be a few times when more than 4 photographers are permitted to attend — we call them WCM Paparazzi Shoot-Outs. They are  purposely created to lower the cost of the events. 

The WCM models chosen to join have been interviewed, and have passed a series of criteria to participate. These models are professional and work well beyond the hours of a WCM event. They scout locations, contact venues, determine if permits are required or not and obtain them if feasible. Some events require they rent wardrobe or equipment. It’s obvious there is a great deal of time on there part doing all of that. 

This group nor the models do any TFPs... Ever. 

What's nice is the photographers never have to spend any time editing, copying or distributing pictures to models. That's right. Photographers are not obligated to share their pictures nor are the models expecting any from them. 

WorldChoiceModels is ideal for:

• Photographers that want to do street photography or photowalks with a model. 

• Photographers looking to practice their skills, experiment with their equipment or technique.

• Photographers looking to expand their portfolios. bridal, senior portraits, couples, fashion, commercial lifestyle, editorial, etc. 

From time to time there will be workshops on studio lighting, and specific genres. So keep a look out. 

WCM hopes to attract women photographers. It seems that almost all the modeling Meetup groups market to men through their theme or content of the event. 

This is an excellent forum for EVERYONE (men and women) to practice and build their portfolios. 

My best to everyone

John Bodensiek, Founder and Professional Photographer
results.name: !! Central-New Jersey. Exclusive events for photographers

topics.name: Restoring the US Constitution in Government
The Constitution and Our Founding Principles

results.description:
http://www.njoathkeepers.org/

Orders We Will Not Obey

“The time is now near at hand which must probably determine, whether Americans are to be, Freemen, or Slaves; whether they are to have any property they can call their own; whether their Houses, and Farms, are to be pillaged and destroyed, and they consigned to a State of Wretchedness from which no human efforts will probably deliver them. The fate of unborn Millions will now depend, under God, on the Courage and Conduct of this army” – Gen. George Washington, to his troops before the battle of Long Island

Such a time is near at hand again. The fate of unborn millions will now depend, under God, on the Courage and Conduct of this Army – and this Marine Corps, This Air Force, This Navy and the National Guard and police units of these sovereign states. Oath Keepers is a non-partisan association of currently serving military, reserves, National Guard, peace officers, fire-fighters, and veterans who swore an oath to support and defend the Constitution against all enemies, foreign and domestic … and meant it.

We won’t “just follow orders.” Below is our declaration of orders we will NOT obey because we will consider them unconstitutional (and thus unlawful) and immoral violations of the natural rights of the people. Such orders would be acts of war against the American people by their own government, and thus acts of treason. We will not make war against our own people. We will not commit treason. We will defend the Republic.

Declaration of Orders We Will NOT Obey

Recognizing that we each swore an oath to support and defend the Constitution against all enemies, foreign and domestic, and affirming that we are guardians of the Republic, of the principles in our Declaration of Independence, and of the rights of our people, we affirm and declare the following:

1. We will NOT obey any order to disarm the American people.

The attempt to disarm the people on April 19, 1775 was the spark of open conflict in the American Revolution. That vile attempt was an act of war, and the American people fought back in justified, righteous self-defense of their natural rights. Any such order today would also be an act of war against the American people, and thus an act of treason. We will not make war on our own people, and we will not commit treason by obeying any such treasonous order. Nor will we assist, or support any such attempt to disarm the people by other government entities, either state or federal. In addition, we affirm that the purpose of the Second Amendment is to preserve the military power of the people so that they will, in the last resort, have effective final recourse to arms and to the God of Hosts in the face of tyranny. Accordingly, we oppose any and all further infringements on the right of the people to keep and bear arms. In particular we oppose a renewal of the misnamed “assault-weapons” ban or the enactment of H.R. 45 (which would register and track gun owners like convicted pedophiles).

2. We will NOT obey any order to conduct warrantless searches of the American people, their homes, vehicles, papers, or effects – such as warrantless house-to house searches for weapons or persons.

One of the causes of the American Revolution was the use of “writs of assistance,” which were essentially warrantless searches because there was no requirement of a showing of probable cause to a judge, and the first fiery embers of American resistance were born in opposition to those infamous writs. The Founders considered all warrantless searches to be unreasonable and egregious. It was to prevent a repeat of such violations of the right of the people to be secure in their persons, houses, papers, and effects that the Fourth Amendment was written. We expect that sweeping warrantless searches of homes and vehicles, under some pretext, will be the means used to attempt to disarm the people.

3. We will NOT obey any order to detain American citizens as “unlawful enemy combatants” or to subject them to trial by military tribunal.

One of the causes of the American Revolution was the denial of the right to jury trial, the use of admiralty courts (military tribunals) instead, and the application of the laws of war to the colonists. After that experience, and being well aware of the infamous Star Chamber in English history, the Founders ensured that the international laws of war would apply only to foreign enemies, not to the American people. Thus, the Article III Treason Clause establishes the only constitutional form of trial for an American, not serving in the military, who is accused of making war on his own nation. Such a trial for treason must be before a civilian jury, not a tribunal. The international laws of war do not trump our Bill of Rights. We reject as illegitimate any such claimed power, as did the Supreme Court in Ex Parte Milligan (1865). Any attempt to apply the laws of war to American civilians, under any pretext, such as against domestic “militia” groups the government brands “domestic terrorists,” is an act of war and an act of treason.

4. We will NOT obey orders to impose martial law or a “state of emergency” on a state, or to enter with force into a state, without the express consent and invitation of that state’s legislature and governor.

One of the causes of the American Revolution was the attempt “to render the Military independent of and superior to the Civil Power” by disbanding the Massachusetts legislature and appointing General Gage as “military governor.” The attempt to disarm the people of Massachusetts during that martial law sparked our Revolution. Accordingly, the power to impose martial law – the absolute rule over the people by a military officer with his will alone being law – is nowhere enumerated in our Constitution. Further, it is the militia of a state and of the several states that the Constitution contemplates being used in any context, during any emergency within a state, not the standing army. The imposition of martial law by the national government over a state and its people, treating them as an occupied enemy nation, is an act of war. Such an attempted suspension of the Constitution and Bill of Rights voids the compact with the states and with the people.

5. We will NOT obey orders to invade and subjugate any state that asserts its sovereignty and declares the national government to be in violation of the compact by which that state entered the Union.

In response to the obscene growth of federal power and to the absurdly totalitarian claimed powers of the Executive, upwards of 20 states are considering, have considered, or have passed courageous resolutions affirming states rights and sovereignty. Those resolutions follow in the honored and revered footsteps of Jefferson and Madison in their Kentucky and Virginia Resolutions, and likewise seek to enforce the Constitution by affirming the very same principles of our Declaration, Constitution, and Bill of Rights that we Oath Keepers recognize and affirm. Chief among those principles is that ours is a dual sovereignty system, with the people of each state retaining all powers not granted to the national government they created, and thus the people of each state reserved to themselves the right to judge when the national government they created has voided the compact between the states by asserting powers never granted. Upon the declaration by a state that such a breach has occurred, we will not obey orders to force that state to submit to the national government.

6. We will NOT obey any order to blockade American cities, thus turning them into giant concentration camps.

One of the causes of the American Revolution was the blockade of Boston, and the occupying of that city by the British military, under martial law. Once hostilities began, the people of Boston were tricked into turning in their arms in exchange for safe passage, but were then forbidden to leave. That confinement of the residents of an entire city was an act of war. Such tactics were repeated by the Nazis in the Warsaw Ghetto, and by the Imperial Japanese in Nanking, turning entire cities into death camps. Any such order to disarm and confine the people of an American city will be an act of war and thus an act of treason.

7. We will NOT obey any order to force American citizens into any form of detention camps under any pretext.

Mass, forced internment into concentration camps was a hallmark of every fascist and communist dictatorship in the 20th Century. Such internment was unfortunately even used against American citizens of Japanese descent during World War II. Whenever a government interns its own people, it treats them like an occupied enemy population. Oppressive governments often use the internment of women and children to break the will of the men fighting for their liberty – as was done to the Boers, to the Jewish resisters in the Warsaw Ghetto, and to the Chechens, for example. Such a vile order to forcibly intern Americans without charges or trial would be an act of war against the American people, and thus an act of treason, regardless of the pretext used. We will not commit treason, nor will we facilitate or support it.”NOT on Our Watch!”

8. We will NOT obey orders to assist or support the use of any foreign troops on U.S. soil against the American people to “keep the peace” or to “maintain control” during any emergency, or under any other pretext.

We will consider such use of foreign troops against our people to be an invasion and an act of war. During the American Revolution, the British government enlisted the aid of Hessian mercenaries in an attempt to subjugate the rebellious American people. Throughout history, repressive regimes have enlisted the aid of foreign troops and mercenaries who have no bonds with the people. Accordingly, as the militia of the several states are the only military force contemplated by the Constitution, in Article I, Section 8, for domestic keeping of the peace, and as the use of even our own standing army for such purposes is without such constitutional support, the use of foreign troops and mercenaries against the people is wildly unconstitutional, egregious, and an act of war. We will oppose such troops as enemies of the people and we will treat all who request, invite, and aid those foreign troops as the traitors they are.

9. We will NOT obey any orders to confiscate the property of the American people, including food and other essential supplies, under any emergency pretext whatsoever.

One of the causes of the American Revolution was the seizure and forfeiture of American ships, goods, and supplies, along with the seizure of American timber for the Royal Navy, all in violation of the people’s natural right to their property and to the fruits of their labor. The final spark of the Revolution was the attempt by the government to seize powder and cannon stores at Concord. Deprivation of food has long been a weapon of war and oppression, with millions intentionally starved to death by fascist and communist governments in the 20th Century alone. Accordingly, we will not obey or facilitate orders to confiscate food and other essential supplies from the people, and we will consider all those who issue or carry out such orders to be the enemies of the people.

10. We will NOT obey any orders which infringe on the right of the people to free speech, to peaceably assemble, and to petition their government for a redress of grievances.

There would have been no American Revolution without fiery speakers and writers such as James Otis, Patrick Henry, Thomas Paine, and Sam Adams “setting brushfires of freedom in the minds of men.” Patrick Henry: “Give me Liberty, or Give me DEATH!” Tyrants know that the pen of a man such as Thomas Paine can cause them more damage than entire armies, and thus they always seek to suppress the natural rights of speech, association, and assembly. Without freedom of speech, the people will have no recourse but to arms. Without freedom of speech and conscience, there is no freedom. Therefore, we will not obey or support any orders to suppress or violate the right of the people to speak, associate, worship, assemble, communicate, or petition government for the redress of grievances. — And for the support of this Declaration, with a firm reliance on the protection of Divine Providence, we mutually affirm our oath and pledge to each other our Lives, our Fortunes, and our sacred Honor. Oath Keepers The above list is not exhaustive but we do consider them to be clear tripwires – they form our “line in the sand,” and if we receive such orders, we will not obey them. Further, we will know that the time for another American Revolution is nigh. If you the people decide that you have no recourse, and such a revolution comes, at that time, not only will we NOT fire upon our fellow Americans who righteously resist such egregious violations of their God given rights, we will join them in fighting against those who dare attempt to enslave them.

NOTE: please also read our Principles of Our Republic We Are Sworn to Defend

Oath Keepers is a non partisan association of currently serving military, peace officers, fire-fighters, and veterans who will fulfill our oath to support and defend the Constitution against all enemies, foreign and domestic, so help us God.

Our oath is to the Constitution, not to the politicians, and not to any political party. In the long-standing tradition of the U.S. military, we are apolitical. We don’t care if unlawful orders come from a Democrat or a Republican, or if the violation is bi-partisan. We will not obey unconstitutional (and thus unlawful) and immoral orders, such as orders to disarm the American people or to place them under martial law. We won’t “just follow orders.” Our motto: “Not on Our Watch!” or to put it even more succinctly, in the words of 101st Airborne Commander General Anthony McAuliffe at the Battle of the Bulge, “NUTS!” There is at this time a debate within the ranks of the military regarding their oath. Some mistakenly believe they must follow any order the President issues. But many others do understand that their loyalty is to the Constitution and to the people, and understand what that means.

The mission of Oath Keepers is to vastly increase their numbers. We are in a battle for the hearts and minds of our own troops. Help us win it. www.oathkeepers.org
results.name: Oath Keepers -- Bergen County NJ

results.description:
Welcome to the Light & Shadow Workshop Group.

Our mission is to share with the New York independent film community the knowledge and practical skills needed to excel in the art of lighting and cinematography.

When it is your turn to make a movie, you must ask two questions:

1) "Where should I put the LIGHT?" A single strategically placed light can work the magic of four or five incorrectly placed lights.

2) "How to create SHADOW?" Anybody can switch on a light and flood a scene with light and make it flat and boring. But it is with shadows that you create shape, dimension, depth, and mood.

Light and Shadow Boot Camp is a one-weekend, intensive, hands-on workshop for independent filmmakers and students who want to learn fast, simple and effective lighting techniques without a big-studio budget.

It focuses on sensible, easily applied skills to do a lighting set-up. Participants will quickly become adept at lighting real-world situations through demonstrations, Q&A's, and hands-on experience. You will learn the tips and tricks to creating polished and dynamic lighting that can set mood and capture an audience.

In other words, we won't be lighting the Starship Enterprise. But rather, a human drama.

For more information: http://solarnyc.com/lightingworkshop

Enjoy our Youtube Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AUGPa_t8700

You can also add us on Facebook : http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=147904045230476#!/Solar.Productions
Thank you and hope to you see there!

LIPN can HELP you and your family by offering services included but not limited to prepping, Food/Water Preparation, Survival Supplies and their uses, Home Fortification, Home security,Surviving off the Power Grid,Water Purification, Urban survival, all forms of Communications, Bug In/Out Locations,Convoy Operations, Escape and Evasion situations, Tactical Shooting, Weapons Retention, First time gun owning/buying, and many many more .

The LIPN is a group made up of people from all walks of life who live all over Long Island, training, preparing and waiting for the apocalypse or any other man made or natural disaster. We are everyday people. we are mothers AND fathers, brothers and sisters, aunts and uncles. we are doctors, sanitation workers, police officers, military service personnel and school teachers. we are preppers and survivalists preparing for all worst case scenarios and S.H.T.F. situations. A disaster could be anything from a person infected by a pandemic outbreak to a crazy nut job, criminal or gangster who wants to hurt your family and steal your food and preps. The apocalypse could come in the form a hurricane, earthquake, financial Economic Collapse, EMP, polar cap shift or terrorist attack etc etc!!!  we can prep, train and ready ourselves for anything and everything while also helping others like family, friends and other LIPN members in a time of need!! Our goal as LIPN is to connect our states, cities, communities and their people. to help and train people to survive in any situation. We can offer self and home defense, community watch and natural disaster response as well as wilderness, urban survival and prepping. We also sponsor community events such as picnics, dinners, dances, parties, charity events and conduct fund raisers to help other in need - and to survive!!!

results.description: The group is to foster the vision of community leaders looking to create centers of learning and spiritual development in the Greater New York and Connecticut area. Our founding members are looking to create a school for children based on spiritual growth and creating leaders who are harnessing the best of human potential. Meetings will be bi-monthly or monthly in Manhattan and in the summer months we will find locations in outdoor areas of New York and Connecticut to enhance our connection to nature and ourselves. In our gatherings we practice tools for spiritual healing that empower members to move forward with their life vision and building love and loving relationships. We learn tools to balance and understand the emotions, to listen to the body and to heal any imbalances in the body and emotions and soul. Our GOAL is to create a team of leaders, teachers, board members and support for the school that will teach children how to be empowered and express their emotions effectively in order to create communities and - ultimately - a society of peace.
results.name: New York Spiritual Healing Group

results.description:
A virtual homeschooling cooperative for families with kids K-12 to connect and share interests through workshops, park days, community service, trips, tours and more.

HOW TO POST:

Please note that when you post a new event, it may take up to 24 hours for your event to be announced to other members with you designated as the event "host." Once you are designated the host and your Meetup event is official, you can add an RSVP limit to your post. (Meetup sets up the site this way, so that the site "organizers" have 24 hours to delete any inappropriate posts.)

Fortunately, for those of you who post frequently, you can be added as event organizers, so that you can edit your event RSVP limit immediately and announce it to the group without waiting to be designated a host.

Members should charge no more than the actual cost of admission (e.g., museum entrance, class/material fees, or theater tickets). If you are advertising a paid series of classes, please only post the first meeting date, so that all members aren't receiving reminders every week in their inboxes.

Please note that we don't currently have a working Paypal account for the auto-pay option, so please select "offline" as the payment option and include your Paypal email address in your description of the trip (or make other arrangements for payment). (You will not receive money if you check the Paypal option, as it is not currently linked to a Paypal account!)

After you host an event please take the time to make a note of attendance by selecting "Tools" and "Edit attendance" from the drop-down menu on the right-hand side of your event's page.

HOW TO RSVP:

When you RSVP, please remember to add the TOTAL number of guests you will be bringing. If you don't do so, you may not have the necessary number of spots needed to attend. To add guests, select "Change RSVP" (green button) to add your guests.

MEMBER AGREEMENT:

Please read before you join! By joining the group, you agree to the following:

In order to remain a member, a member must ATTEND AT LEAST ONE MEETUP within three months of joining and thereafter post and attend at least one event annually.

This is a cooperative, member-run (unmoderated) group. The group "owners/organizers" are such in name only--we will try to keep the Meetup group online for members to use (or will offer to turn over the account to another member if we cannot do so), but will neither attend all events nor know the details of all of them, so please email the event "host" if you have a question about a posted event.

Everyone knows that plans change, but PLEASE remember to update your RSVP if you can no longer attend a Meetup, giving enough time for the people on the waiting list to take your spot. Members who consistently fail to communicate about a change in plans may be removed from the group.

Members should be considerate of other members and be responsible for his/her families' behavior and safety. Please do not engage in harassment, flaming, or other aggressive behavior in-person or on-line. This is a virtual group with open membership--anyone on the Internet can join. Please use common sense when participating, as you would do in other online communities, and don't send out personal information (such as your address or phone number, for example) to members you do not know.

 

We hope to meet you soon! Happy posting!
results.name: homeschoolnewyorkcity

results.description:
http://edelage.wix.com/edge

This group welcomes guitar players of ALL LEVELS. Yes, you can join if you're a total beginner, guitars, basses and ukeleles welcome, there will be a part for you to play! We'll play arrangements of popular songs and perform at venues in NYC.

Arrangements will be written for distinct guitar parts, we can have as many guitars as we want as long as they are following one of the guitar charts.

GUITAR 1: Simple accompaniment; ideal for beginners playing 3 years or less; open chords, power chords and simple bass lines.

GUITAR 2: Melody and add-ons; ideal for players comfortable with rhythm involving eighth notes, eighth rests, basic lead skills, comfortable with strumming.

GUITAR 3: 16th note rhythm, 7th chords, extended chords, altered chords, barre chords

GUITAR 4&5: Solo and fxs; ideal for players comfortable with lead guitar, sixteenth notes, ties, slides, bends, hammer ons/pull offs and able to manage their instrument levels, fx pedals and dynamics.

To participate;

    You must bring your guitar

    You must download and bring your chart to follow

    You must be able to follow charts (tablature or standard notation)

    You must know the very basics of your instrument

So, join in and come have fun playing your guitar with us!

Watch our latest performance here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GpKdTkVACSU...

For practice support go to:

https://edgeguitarpedia.wordpress.com/The Guitarpedia
results.name: Eliane Delage Guitar Ensemble

results.description:
Hi UXers! We've created this Meetup group to help get the word out about the UX Awards- www.UserExperienceAwards.com

THE UXIES ARE THE PREMIER AWARDS FOR EXCEPTIONAL DIGITAL EXPERIENCE. 
The UXies inspire all technologists to create elegant, human-centered products that solve real customer problems by showcasing next-generation digital products, honoring the most talented UX innovators, and highlighting exceptional user-centered design best practices.

Details about the 2016 UXies will be announced in 6-9 months.

The 5th Annual UXies November 16, 2015 in New York. The UXies are a daytime UX intensive + evening product showcase and celebration!

• Optional daytime intensive with 30 expert talks from winners & judges

• Evening awards showcase reveals the 20 winners, featuring video UX case studies of each

• Champagne reception, swag & swanky after-party

The 2015 Schedule:

DAYTIME TALKS | 9:15AM – 6:15PM 
· 30 15-20 minute fast-paced talks and QA sessions from expert judges, advisory board members, winners and invited special guests· Hear from each of the 8 judges on their approach to UX and their current areas of professional focus· Hear from the 20 finalists talking about their projects as case studies· This is an international UX symposium- 90% of the 20 winners, 80% 8 guest speakers and 75% of the 8 presenting judges are not from NYC! SEE THE FULL SPEAKER LIST OF 30 SPEAKERS  

1.  Memory and Expression by Jake Barton, Local Projects

2.  Context as Conversation by Giles Colborne, cxpartners

3.  The Future of Creativity and Design: Collaboration and Co-Creation by Alex Cuthbert, PicsArt

4.  Designing Experience Online and Offline by Katie Dill, Airbnb

5.  Expressing Brand Through Software by Bill Flora, Tectonic

6.  Experience Design at McKinsey & Co by Jennifer Kilian and Jennifer Speciale, McKinsey & Company

7.  Org Design for Design Orgs by Peter Merholz

8.  Creating Breakthrough UX in a Large Organization – Observations From the Front Line by Ian Worley, Morgan Stanley

9.  NailSnaps: Putting Power In (And On) People’s Hands by Angel Anderson, NailSnaps

10.  UX in a Conservative World: Redesigning the Air Traffic Controller’s Mindset by Lennart Andersson, Veryday

11.  Metropolitan Police Mobility Project by Rachel Armstrong, We Are Experience

12.  Simple is Hard: Creating UX for Users Who Don’t Care if You’re Smart by Amos Bloomberg and Craig von Wiederhold, SS+K

13.  Designing a Design System by Jina Bolton, Salesforce

14.  Visualizing UX: Journeys, Places and Stories by Séamus Byrne, Graphic Mint

15.  Winner Q&A with Tomer (Tommy) Dikerman, Comeets

16.  Metopera.org: Behind the Curtain by Erin Disselhorst, Lauren Shapiro and Aleks Gryczon, Work & Co

17.  Graham Ericksen, Modus

18.  Designing for Virtual Reality by Alex Faaborg, Google

19.  AIBI Allergy Alert System: Stopping Fatal Allergies through Design by Daniel Galán

20.  Emerging Trends in Experience Design and Their Impact On the Now by Joe Jacobellis (HCA IT&S), Cliff Sexton (The Home Depot), Scott Wilkinson (Bank of America/Merrill Lynch), Dana Wilson (Comcast), KC Wolff-Ingham (Sparks Grove), and Andy Knight (TIAA-CREF )

21.  Case Study – Mobile Web for News by Feliphe Lavor, Huge

22.  Todd Lefelt, Huge

23.  SAP Splash – Design Better Experiences by Anna Lewandowski and Laurent Nguyen, SAP

24.  ViVi: A Head-Mounted Display to Help Medical Clinicians Monitor Patient Health by David Lipkin, Method

25.  BILT: Assembly Made Easy by Natasha Lloyd, SAP

26.  Henri: Creating Languages for Smart Objects by Daniel Nacamuli, Method

27.  Winner Q&A with Zachary Orr, MailChimp

28.  Scaling Insight for Big Data by Matthew Weber, Zoomdata


EVENING RECEPTION | 6:15PM 


Champagne reception with hors d’oeuvres and live music in the reception room 



EVENING AWARDS EVENT | 7:15PM – 9:30PM 


· See 3-5 minute overviews of all the winning projects: Grand Prize, Gold, Silver, Bronze, Finalist, People’s Choice, Secret Admirer and Student· Hear from each of the judges on how they evaluated the submissions· Meet the winners and hear the Grand and Gold winners talk about their projects 



AFTER-PARTY CELEBRATION AT GRAPE & VINE! | 9:30PM – 11PM 


Join us to celebrate with complimentary cocktails, champagne, wine and tapas across the street at the elegant and intimate 

Grape & Vine

More than 1,000 Trail Conference Volunteers donate 70,000 hours of work each year, building and maintaining 1,850 miles of trails.

We also develop and publish high-quality maps and books that provide people with information they need to responsibly access and enjoy the bountiful open space found in this region. We have about 9,500 individuals and 90 organizational members representing 100,000 outdoor enthusiasts.

results.description:
Would you like to communicate effectively?

    Want to overcome your fear of public speaking?

    Want to build better communication skills?

    Want to be more articulate and persuasive and speak with confidence?

    Want to become a leader?

Now you can! Toastmasters will show you how to speak confidently, listen effectively and think on your feet. You will learn valuable communication and leadership skills - all in a friendly and supportive, non-intimidating environment.

Bay Ridge Toastmasters is a local chapter of Toastmasters International which is a world leader in communication and leadership development where members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending meeting to practice first hand. This group is open to everyone.

Come free as a guest and witness for yourself what we accomplish. Everyone is welcome to attend! We are a very friendly group and we all help each other.

Everyone can learn and network while having a good time and some laughs.

We meet every 1st and 3rd Wednesday at 7:00 pm.

Please visit our Club Web-site:

http://8131.toastmastersclubs.org

Meeting Location: Brooklyn Campus of VA Hospital (Bay Ridge), 800 Poly Place, 2nd floor, Room 2-415. Please use the following URL link for the directions http://bit.ly/uRLslT

PARKING: There is free parking on the hospital's premises; please inform the security guard that you arrived for a Toastmasters meeting.

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION

Take the B-8 or B70 bus to VA Hospital (last stop)


Please RSVP to brtoastmasters@gmail.com or call 347 560 8701.

Facebook Page: http://on.fb.me/rSZSsq

To learn more about Toastmasters International organization, we invite you to visit their website at www.toastmasters.org.

Our meetings are a learn-by-doing workshop in which participants hone their speaking and leadership skills in a friendly atmosphere. There is no instructor. Instead, members evaluate one another’s presentations. This feedback process is a key part of the program’s success. Meeting participants also give impromptu talks on assigned topics, conduct meetings and develop skills related to timekeeping, grammar and parliamentary procedure. Members learn communication skills by working in the Competent Communication manual, a series of 10 self-paced speaking assignments designed to instill a basic foundation in public speaking.
results.name: Bay Ridge Toastmasters

results.description:
We like to play fast, advanced pickup soccer. THIS GAME IS NOT FOR BEGINNER OR INTERMEDIATE PLAYERS. We sometimes like to go out for beer afterwards. We like players who pass the ball and don't slide tackle. We just like to have fun and meet new people. If this sounds like you, come play!

We use the following rules in our group to make it fair for everyone:

1) Play can be quite fast and aggressive, but friendly. If the ball goes out, call it out even if the other team gets the throw in. Don't argue about every goal. Sometimes you fall down or get kicked, but do not foul. We ask repeat offenders to leave the group.

2) We have no waiting list for games. If a game fills up, you can only jump on a spot if someone cancels. Anyone can come to the game to see if a spot is open, but if it is full, sorry.

3) COME ON TIME. If you are not ready to play at the scheduled start time, you cannot play. If someone is there to play on time, they get your spot. Even if no one else is there to take your spot, you can't play if you come late. We are serious about this.

4) No shows prevent other people from playing, so always cancel as early as possible if you can't make it. WE TAKE THE RSVP LIST ONE HOUR BEFORE THE GAME - AFTER THAT IF YOU CANCEL YOU ARE CONSIDERED A NO SHOW. If you are a no-show multiple times, you will be removed from the Meetup group. This is so that other people can have time to rsvp yes if you cancel.

5) If you play, play the entire scheduled game. It is not fair to people on the waiting list or your teammates if you leave early. We will remove you from the group if you a repeat offender.

6) We'll collect payment in cash at the start of every game. Bring exact change! We use this to get pinnies, cones, goals, better balls, and to pay our monthly Meetup fee.

7) Our pinnies are currently red and neon green. Please do not wear a red, yellow or neon green shirt to games.

See you on the pitch!

results.description:
This group is for anyone who has experienced the death of a loved one.

It is intended to be a sacred space to share with one another our experiences, our losses and our realizations.

My Story:

My husband, Jagatpati das passed away on Dec 17th, 2008 in Cairns Australia. Several months after he passed, I decided that to heal and find myself again, I needed to leave all that was familiar to me and commit wholly to the journey of self discovery and realization.

My journey took me half way across the world where, by the support of a loving community, I gained strength enough to carve out new career paths and to create a life here in New York.

If, like me, you’ve lost your spouse or a loved one, I hope that joining this group will ease your pain - heal your heart and give you strength. The day will come when the pain becomes tolerable, like a somber friend accompanying you through life, reminding you of the trauma you have survived.

It is my fervant prayer that you will discover the healing light of meaning in your loss and when you are ready, let shine this light for others.
results.name: Life after death - NY

results.description:
This group brings together avid readers once a month for a vegan food potluck and discussion of a prize-winning fictional novel. You don't need to be a vegan to join, and, no, the books are not vegan-based! This is not a political group, just a group of smart people who like to discuss books over good food. We incorporate a wide variety of genres, from science fiction to classics to comedy to metafiction--we strive for diversity in our literary selections! Interested persons should note, however, that this is a fiction group; we do not read biographies or poetry or investigative journalism or other forms of non-fiction. 

I do not charge a fee for this book club to cover organizer fees--something many groups do. Your monetary contribution comes from bringing a delicious vegan-friendly dish to share. Not all members are vegan and people do occasionally bring dishes with dairy or honey--just please be sure to note it so that members who may have allergies or who are strictly vegan are aware of this. Also, I am gluten-free and always appreciate gluten-free dishes! But that's not at all a requirement of the potluck. 

I want this meetup to be an active group with regular attendees. Because of this, the group has a two strikes rule. If you RSVP and don't show to two events without canceling your RSVP, you will be removed. Also, I believe it is better to have a smaller group of active members than a huge list of inactive members and have decided to cap membership at 100. If you have been inactive for over six months you might be removed to make room for other more active members. You can always rejoin later if you like.

topics.name: What's the Future of Content Marketing

Content Creation & Curation for the Internet

results.description:
Lean Content is about maximizing impact with minimal resources through content. See videos and presentations of our San Francisco Meetup here.

The concept of “lean content” is an evolution of content development and content marketing strategies. Lean Content focuses on developing value-adding, modern web media around a central thematic element as defined by a content strategy. What is produced can be translated across media types (ex. A blog can turn into an infographic, into a podcast) and distributed effectively and efficiently with specific focus on the social web and strategic communications.

Lean Content focuses on creating an environment of experimentation and a tight feedback loop around the central brand thematic element, and through trial and error, performance measurement, and iteration creates an authentic, connected set of brand communications. Lean Content places priority on the development of content that performs well on the social web and viral internet environments over traditional content types (white papers, data sheets, etc). The marketing of content developed with the Lean mentality also leverages modern web practices, including social media marketing, community content marketing, external placement, SEM, creative email marketing, and content curation.
results.name: Lean Content NYC

topics.name: Yoga Dance Classes with World Music, Meditations

results.description:
A weekly dance meditation, an exploration into ourselves, our bodies, connection to spirit, love, truth, play, heal, grow with the unique practice of the 5Rhythms: softening in Flowing, edging in Staccato, releasing in Chaos, expanding in Lyrical, dissolving in Stillness. 5Rhythms® Dream Waves is an invitation to wake up to our essence, our bodies and our own dreams. To dance is to dream, to dream is to build, to build is to know who we are, what serves us and what we are here to serve. Getting inside the texture of our dreams is as essential as food, shelter and family. They shape us forward towards creative and constructive action, towards our essential footprint on the Planet.

There are no right or wrong moves in this practice, no choreography or steps, the body naturally opens up and follows the wave of music and energy. Curiosity, willingness to move, layered comfortable clothing, water bottle, bare feet - is all that is required. The rest is up to the dance.

Through movement we unlock potential, get un-stuck and invite creativity to flow freely through us. Join our alive, heart-throbbing, truth seeking, transfoiming-sweat-to-gold, mighty moving group!

What are the 5Rhythms©?

Other 5Rhythms© classes in NYC/Long Island
results.name: 5Rhythms® Dream Waves

We are open to all people in the 20s, 30s & 40s age range that identify as (but not limited to!) polyamorous, LGBT, poly-curious, poly-friendly, swingers, kinksters, monogamish, undefined, open, etc. We are not tied to labels as sexuality is fluid for many of us.

results.description: This is a group for folks who are interested in having life be stress-free, productive, passionate and most of all - fun! Saying YES to your life is a great way to drop those automatic, habitual complaints and discover both your own brilliance and the beauty of the current moment. Saying YES allows you to be the author of your life, rather than the victim of it. New possibilities appear that never existed before! We learned this fun and practical approach to Saying Yes to Your Life from the Instantaneous Transformation workshops of Ariel and Shya Kane. As we continue to bring a non-judgemental awareness to our lives and say YES to how it shows up, we watch our lives expand in every direction - career, finances, creativity, communication, plus our marriage is sweeter, closer and more fun than ever before. Saying YES is fun to share and practice with others. Community is a great way to support your YES habit. So, we invite you to join us for a Meetup filled with fun and inspiring people - like you!

As a certified personal trainer and black belt in Karate, I will teach you how to get fit in fun innovative ways; yoga on the beach, kayaking get togethers, strength training everywhere and anywhere. Boxing. Karate. The opportunities to get healthy are endless.

Fitness doesn't have to be blood, sweat and tears. It can be laughter, memories, and new friends.

But being healthy takes more than working out.
It's about managing your sleep, eating well, getting massages, meditating, managing your pain - and taking care of yourself. I'm here to help you take care of yourself, and will teach you how to do so.

We'll start by working out, then I'll teach you some wellness tips, then we'll have some healthy bites, and make some new friends. Consider it a day of wellness.

This meetup is for anyone who enjoys walking and meeting new people. Most days, we will be a walking group, while other days an adventure group.  We'll walk at our own pace; some of us will walk a little faster and some will want to walk a little slower.

We know that people come to meetups to meet other people and, hopefully, form friendships. In our group, we pride ourselves on being welcoming and friendly to each other, whether you're new to the group or have been a member for a while.

After some of the walks, we have a scheduled coffee/breakfast/dinner and you are all welcome to join us (OPTIONAL). The meeting place will change from time to time, but will mostly be within Essex County.  There will be the occasional meetup where we get-together for other activities and out-of-town jaunts! We are a fun and welcoming group and look forward to meeting you at our next walk.

Participating in NNJ Sole Mates is entirely voluntary and you are responsible for your own safety. When you RSVP 'Yes' for any NNJ Sole Mate walks/events, you are confirming that you understand and accept the risks, dangers and hazards of any outdoor activity and you are releasing and discharging the NNJ Sole Mate organizer (including assistant organizers and hosts) against any liability that arises from your participation in our group or its activities. Your organizer is a volunteer with no special training or qualifications. Think of me as a friend showing you around a place that I enjoy. I am not responsible for your safety or actions or anyone else’s.

Please note that soliciting is not allowed in our group.  In order to join our group, a real photo of yourself must be posted (not of your dog, cat, etc.).  Late cancellations and no-shows are unkind.  After three no-shows, you will be removed from our Meetup group.

Please take a look at our Liability Disclaimer & Waiver, as well as our Attendance and Cancellation Policy on the PAGES tab at the top of our Meetup Site.

topics.name: Restoring the US Constitution in Government

results.description:
Let's De-Program together...

If you're like me, you're probably someone assumes is a liberal because of your taste in music or dress... and has to "come out" as not one. You don't understand why everyone has to adhere so neatly and conform to group/sub-cultural stereotypes in the first place. Why can't people think for themselves? Why can't we be lots of things?

If you're like me, you over-hear Liberals talk and think, "I know what they're thinking- I would have disliked (the new, conservative) me too, but I didn't know better then", "I used to say things like that", "That used to be me, and I'm embarrassed for them to hear them talk/think that way".

If you're like me, you know that most Liberals probably would never understand the way you feel now because they haven't had the EXPERIENCES that drove you to change sides (so to speak) and think differently... and therefore they can't understand.

If you're like me, you find the stereotype about the angry, gun-toting, scared, shaking in their boots, afraid of change, unsophisticated, un-hip, uneducated, unworldly, bigoted (for no legitimate reason, just to be a jerk), mean-spirited conservative to be annoying and so not you. You think Liberals are the anti-intellectual, inexperienced ones and the nasty ones- the intolerant bullies.

If you're like me, you're angry about left wing media bias in this country, and the way history is taught.

If you're like me, you're FED UP with "Identity Politics" and "Political Correctness"/PC and you feel you're drowning in a sea of it- in fact, our whole national culture now revolves around it.

If you're like me, you might even think President Obama is the racist one...

If you're like me, it's really, really hard to find people who fit that match.

If you're like me, you feel like an ex-gang member, or like someone whom no one believes once was a liberal, in every way. You might want to say, "no, wait, I used to think like you, but I don't anymore, let me explain, here's why..." but you somehow never get a chance to.

If you're like me, it's hard to even swallow the level of change you've been through ideologically, even in the span of a few years.

If you're like me, it's hard to find friends in a city where everyone at least totes the "party line" and doesn't "get" where you're coming from, or understand the experiences you had that pushed you to switch sides.

You realize you're an ideological minority (and therefore, a target) in super liberal NYC... which is soooo hard, especially when it comes to friendships. A lot of liberals would not want you for a friend- they're embarrassed by you.

Let's hang out, have dinner at restaurants, drink a few drinks, perhaps have house parties, and most importantly, meet like, tolerant and understanding minds.
results.name: Ex-Liberals NYC

results.description:
The Interstate Hiking Club is a medium sized hiking club that is affiliated with the NY/NJ Trail Conference and has been a trail maintaining club since 1931. Most of our activities are centered in the NY/NJ area. Some hikes, bicycle rides and canoe trips are farther away. Trips or events may just be for the day, or are sometimes for a week. Guests may attend 3 events before becoming members. IHC rules apply to participants that attend through meetup. Membership in IHC is $10 a year. Ask your leader about membership!

Hikes, bicycle rides and canoe trips generally are scheduled for every Sunday, and some Fridays and Saturdays, as day-long outings. They are graded by difficulty of terrain, distance and pace. The Hiking grades are: Easy: These hikes are 3 to 5 miles in length and should have no significant hills. Moderate: These hikes are 5 to 8 miles and may take up to 5 hours, including time for trail lunch. They should not generally have multiple long steep hills, and should be at a moderate pace. Moderately Strenuous: These hikes are 5 to 8 miles with multiple steep hills or 8 miles or more which are mostly flat walking. They can last up to 6 hours, including trail lunch. Pace to be moderate. Strenuous: Not for novices. Hikes are 8 miles or more and last 6 hours or more, including time for trail lunch. These may have many long steep hills and may be at a brisk pace. Most hikes get back about 3:30 in the afternoon. But that is not a certainty. Conditions may force an early end, or hikers may be slower than expected.

Be sure to bring enough water and a lunch too. Sturdy footwear is required. Contact the leader if in doubt. The leader may refuse any member or guest who the leader thinks is ill prepared for the trip. Dogs are not allowed on any IHC events. Sorry!
results.name: Interstate Hiking Club

Francesc Riverola

If you miss collaborating with coworkers or feel like you're falling behind on industry intelligence, join us for fun and engaging uptown sessions at Weleet.me.

results.description:
The mission of the New York Metropolitan chapter of AWIS is to empower women to enter, remain, and advance in science careers both inside and outside academia. We provide professional development training and a supportive community with opportunities for networking and mentoring. Our meetup group is our social side! Come out and meet other women in science in the NY area for happy hour or dinner. We welcome other event suggestions too! 

For more information on who we are and what we do, please visit our website!

results.description:
The mobile development profession is moving way too fast for any individual or company to keep up. ModevNYC is a community committed to connecting smart motivated people with the knowledge, ideas and companies that will help them lead the way. We hold regular monthly meetups, record all our sessions.

We also produce full conferences such as The Wearables + Things Conference, ModevCon and ModevUX. Please take a few moments to connect with us socially: Twitter: @gomodev Facebook: /gomodev
results.name: ModevNYC

results.description:
Growing up is hard. You're no longer in the social cocoon of college life, but many of your friends have gotten married and/or started families. You have a nice apartment, but you're not ready to buy a 3-bed/2 bath house. You've got a steady job, but you're not the big boss. You still enjoy nights out, but you want to strangle the kids that won't stop taking selfies.

Making friends in Westchester can also be tough for 20- and 30-somethings. After all, this is the 'burbs, and it's full of families, playgrounds, and school systems. Things that should be so simple - like striking up a conversation at a bar - often seem awkward. And sometimes it seems easier to hang out on the couch with some Netflix.

Our group just wants to meet cool new people while enjoying awesome plates of food. Maybe we work in the same industry, live in the same town, or take the same train. Maybe we both love Star Wars, or have Bassett Hounds, or make really good pierogis. Or maybe we both really hate pumpkin beer. Whatever we have in common, we'll find something to chat about.

Whether you were born in raised in Westchester, relocated from NYC for a quieter life, or moved over here for a job opportunity, we'd love to hear your story. We just ask that you arrive with an appetite and an excitement to meet new people who can become close friends - and local ones, to boot!

We make an effort to host events in different parts of Westchester - the River Towns, the Sound Towns, and Central/Northern Westchester. It you've got a great local place for dinner or drinks, just email one of the organizers and we'll add it to our list of places to visit. Please also let us know if you have other ideas for Meetups (like a hike, a concert, etc.). Sometimes it's nice to  burn calories instead of consume them!
results.name: Looking for Friends in Westchester

results.description: This is a networking group for all downtown Jersey City business owners and business professionals. Our group will encourage business owners, entrepreneurs and professionals to build and maintain lasting relationships with other professionals in our community. We can hold events in the downtown area at local restaurants, bars, coffee shops and stores. Every month we will host business networking events to introduce you to the most dynamic business owners and professionals in the downtown JC area.
results.name: The Downtown Jersey City Business Networking Group

results.description: The group purpose is simple. Become knowledgeable on the great places to go out in downtown Jersey City. We usually meet up a park or public place and go to venues TOGETHER. Nobody likes to walk into a bar or restaurant alone looking for a group.

results.description:
This group is for single parents whose social life has been neglected due to divorce, being busy with kids, moved to a new location, etc. I created this group because i hadn't given my social life proper attention and most of my friends were married. I'm looking to meet other single parents to go out and have fun with on kid-less weekends so I don't wander around aimlessly and find reasons to go to Target on 3 separate occasions. The goal is to get out, be social, meet awesome people, and make friendships. Our events are anything from drinks, dinner, bowling, concerts, festivals, wine-fest, beer-fest, anything ending with fest, dancing, and game nights. Most of our events are in central NJ but occasionally farther. Let's have fun. Shenanigans welcome.

We encourage event ideas to be posted by our members.  If there is something fun that you'd like to do, others may be interested also.

Also, we like our members to be active within the group.  Please try to attend a meetup after joining.  Members who have not attended events after 2 months of joining will be removed.  We'd like to get to know you!  Please come out.

Lastly, there are no dues for this group. We just ask that each member be responsible and mindful to pay for what they eat or drink at an event where the bill may be split.
results.name: Weekends without Kids Social Group

results.description: Every Thursday night New York City galleries from Soho to Chelsea throw opening receptions for their artiste du jour. Throngs of art aficionados make the mad two hour dash between galleries, throwing back mediocre glasses of wine and scarfing down fistfulls of salted peanuts. And while the art is sometimes less than exciting the scene never is. Solo contemplation of a Munch watercolor is fine, but gallery hopping is best done in the company of others. So every week we'll put together a list of the most promising openings, meet at a designated spot, and let the hop begin. Afterwards we'll hit a local bar/restaurant to discuss how wonderful or god awful the night's openings were.

results.description:
This is a group for all of us who work longer than 9 to 5 and have trouble making the "normal" happy hour during the week; young professionals who want to meet new people and break up the week with a fun happy hour.

We will be scheduling both large and small events... so everyone can mingle as well as get to know each other in smaller groups. No name tags, no ice breakers, no gimmicks. Real people. Cold drinks.

Hope to meet up and have a beer!

-Bryan

 

The not-so-fine print:

- Happy hours will start no earlier than 6:30.

- Looking to keep things fun and friendly, so please don't go overboard on the drinking! This is about meeting new people, not getting sloppy.

- Feel free to suggest new venues

- Currently looking for people interested in being organizers to help run the group

 

Group Organizer contact info:

Bryan - meetupbryan@thedigitalowl.com

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in building scalable computing platforms and parallel architectures to process vast amounts of streaming data using Apache Storm real-time data processing framework. We also discuss other projects that complement Storm - for example, Kafka, Kestrel, Zookeper.

We share ideas and learn how to do: real-time event processing, real-time analytics, real-time ETL and so on. We get together to exchange ideas, show real world projects and to network.

 

About Storm:

Storm is a distributed, reliable, fault-tolerant system for processing streams of data. Similar to how Hadoop provides a set of general primitives for doing batch processing, Storm provides a set of general primitives for doing realtime processing. Storm is simple, can be used with any programming language, and is a lot of fun to use! Find more information about Storm at: https://storm.apache.org/

Collection of Storm and Big Data Books
results.name: New York City Apache Storm User Group
