results.description:
A bunch of washed up old people looking to play some soccer.

Group rules:
This group is for fun...not trophies or metals. Enjoy the game, and help other people do the same.

We have a zero tolerance for no-shows. If you RSVP YES and do not show, you will be banned from the group.

Do not RSVP Yes to both Sunday sessions. Price is $5 for your first visit, $1 each time after. Every player must sign a waiver to play. A link is in each invite.

IF YOU ARE TOO SERIOUS/COMPETITIVE, THIS MAY NOT BE THE RIGHT GROUP FOR YOU!!!


Rules of play:
- Cleats/Shin guards recommended.

- NO SLIDE TACKLES!!

- Go easy on the 50/50 challenges. No one wants to leave on a stretcher.

- Pass to your teammates and be patient with players who may be less skilled than you. Everyone wants to touch the ball. If you can run end-to-end with without losing the ball, that's great, but this is likely not the group for you. Consider joining a competitive league instead.

- Be flexible in regards to positioning. Don't expect to play striker every second you are on the field.

- FIGHTING WILL NOT BE TOLERATED.

- We call our own penalties, but they must be called as soon as they occur, by players involved! And if a call is made, just accept it. No arguing.

By requesting membership and taking part in this group activity, you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulations of this meet up. In addition, you acknowledge you are playing at your own risk. No members of the leadership team for this meet up (organizers and/or hosts) will be held responsible for any injuries or mishaps which can occur while partaking in the games.
results.name: Cedar Grove OPEN - Adult Soccer Meetup

results.description:
Become a Startup Specialist

If you are interested in startups, entrepreneurship, or have been thinking of starting a new tech/media company or inventing a new app/software/technology this is for you.

If you are getting ready to launch or have already started testing the waters this meetup will give you insights in to Management 3.0. We will explore the cutting edge of entrepreneurship.

If you want to be better at asking for help and raising funds, this is the meetup for you.

We will look at the latest advances in social science regarding ideation, cofounder matching, team building, and project execution.

We will experiment with new ways of interacting at meetups, exploring ice breakers, challenges, and open discussions.

We will have speakers and experts on bridging the gap between what science knows and what entrepreneurs do. If you have already reached the level of a funded startup it is not too late to explore ways too improve the probability of your success.

This meetup is going to be high on content. On the form side, we are looking for sponsors and venues to support this meetup.

See you soon.

-------------------------------

The Management 3.0 Approach

A better way to build your business

The story of your business success begins with a dedication to a new approach. You must be willing to learn, explore, and invest in what you do not yet know. Great stories are about overcoming challenges. To this end you must not only be willing to overcome challenges, you must seek them out.

The body of Management 3.0 includes thinking lean, working agile creating participatory-knowledge sharing-self organizing-team cultures, and shifting from a fixation on the uncontrollable to the controllable.

The heart of Management 3.0 is about creating meaning. Meaning is extracting personal value from an experience. It is the sense of fulfillment, purpose, joy, serenity, justice, hope, anticipation, or celebration you provide for participants.

Startup Ecology is about educating and training you to be the most effect entrepreneur possible. By blending real world insight and advances in social science, Startup Ecology will increase the likelihood of your succeeding in your endeavor.

Startup Ecology will focus on 4 business themes:

Ideation - Innovation and clear thinking

Team Building - How to be good with humans

Execution - How to be adaptive, resilient, lean

Growth - Become a better leader and manager
results.name: Startup Ecology NY

results.description:

We are online at http///agstem.org!


The ultimate goal is to engage girls with science and technology themes to get them to consider science, technology, engineering, and math fields/careers as goals and options

We will combine the LOVE of science and math of women and men working in tech fields with the POWER of a good story to produce fun picture books for kids from 4-8 yrs old that have girl protagonists who love science and math! We will show science-loving girls in stories as the lead characters.

We need your help! Won't you join us?

results.description:
It’s our belief that food has a unique ability to bring people together and this Meetup is designed to do just that. Komeeda (originally spelled "comida" but we wanted to make it look cooler) in Spanish means a variety of experiences surrounding food... eating, a meal, feast or simply food. 

What is Komeeda? It is a "kommunity" marketplace to help casual diners and foodies Discover new eateries, Taste new cuisines and foods, and Interact with fellow foodies and storytelling chefs.  Unique culinary experiences that New York City and the surrounding areas have to offer, at your fingertips. 

Here you’ll find fun and interactive multi-course prix-fixe restaurant experiences, trips to food festivals, chef competitions and pop-up dining events. We’re the team behind Komeeda (www.komeeda.com) and we're excited to share these unique events with you. If there’s culinary talent out there, we’ll find it and we'll enjoy it together! If there's an awesome restaurants out there and its not glamorized, we'll enjoy and support it together! 

Come with an open mind and an empty stomach! 


A few points about our Kommunity:

1. Gatherings vary from intimate (4 people) to grand (150+ people) .

2. We find restaurants that WANT to host us. Restaurant will cater a prix-fixe multi-course experience with a minimum six (6) different menu items for us to enjoy and to obtain a stronger impression of the culinary skills behind their kitchen. 

3. All RSVPs are pre-paid. Your purchase includes the meal, disclosed beverages, tax and tip. Just show up and enjoy the experience. Please know that your RSVP is non-refundable but transferrable at least 3 hours prior to the event.

4. Please do your best to show up to events on time.

5. Please bring cash in the event you decide to order food or drinks away from the event menu.

6. If you know any restaurants that would like to host us, please shoot us an email to eat@komeeda.com.

Now let's enjoy ourselves!
results.name: Komeeda: Discover. Taste. Interact.

results.description:
Walking in Queens - This is a group for friendly people who want to walk outdoors. Need to lose a few pounds? Not really the exercising type? No worries (neither am I, lol). I am just a regular person trying to lose weight and I believe that building a support network will make that easier and a lot more fun :) I also noticed that there weren't many groups for this specific area in Queens (Elmhurst) so I decided to make one.

This group will revolve around walking outdoors, but there will also be various social events available. Well-being also involves being relaxed and having fun, so we might sketch in the park one day, play board games, or decide to go to a concert in the city on the weekend.

Our home base is at Hoffman Park, in Elmhurst, NY. Walks can start from there to Forest Hills, or go all the way to Astoria or Queens Plaza. We could even walk to Manhattan!

Looking forward to walking with you!

Like us on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/WalkingInQueensMeetup
results.name: Walking in Queens

results.description:
This group is for anyone interested in motorcycle riding and meeting new people. We welcome all types and kinds of bikes, and all skills levels are welcome.

Our central meeting spot will start in Nassau County. We are planning on rides to various locations throughout New York.

To ensure everyone's fun & safety please review terms below, Only If you agree to the below, you may request membership:

    Pay the $10.00 annual membership fee. This fee will be reduced as more members join. This covers costs to keep this Meetup group service online. Meetup charges fees to create these groups, and I think we should all share in those costs. If there are any remaining funds after the fees are paid to Meetup, we will use them to host a party or something. I will not be taking any money from the group.

    Be safe & have fun

    It is expected that you treat everyone with respect during every ride or event you attend.

    We follow all traffic laws.

    Please be aware that there is a zero percent Alcohol/Drug policy on all rides and it is strictly enforced. Absolutely no drinking of any alcohol beverage will be tolerated. This is for your safety and the safety of your fellow riders)

    Please keep your motorcycle in good working order & maintain all necessary paperwork proving it's legality (Registration and insurance)

    This group rides using a staggered formation. If you are not familiar with this talk to the ride leader before the ride begins.

    Everyone gets home safe. We leave no one behind. If you left with us, you return with us.

    EZ pass is the most convenient way to get through the tolls. If you do not have an EZ pass, please let the ride leader know before the ride begins .

    Motorcycle riding is both fun and dangerous. Each member agrees that they participate by his/her own choice. Neither Nassau County Motorcycle Riders or it's Organizers, Co-Organizers, officers, or event co-coordinators assume any responsibility for any or all liability's resulting from any group related event. Any personal injury or property damage occurring during an activity or during personal travel to or from a Meetup is the responsibility of the individual. At no time shall Nassau County Motorcycle Riders or its organizers, co-organizers, officers, or event planners be held liable. You agree to participate in these events at your own risk.
results.name: NASSAU COUNTY MOTORCYCLE RIDERS

results.description:
Looking for a friendly group of intermediate-to-advanced tennis players? SPG Tennis was organized in 1974 to meet that need. Then in 2013, we created the "Central NJ Tennis Meet-Up Group" to publicize the tennis activities SPG members enjoy so much.

SPG plays outdoors mid-April thru October on eight courts in Edison, NJ.  Beginning late October, you can often find hardy SPG members braving the cold on the courts at Kramer Park in Scotch Plains.  

Joining SPG is a great, affordable way to play tennis with others at your level and meet new people.

VERY IMPORTANT NOTE:  Don't let a very-low RSVP sign up number on the Meet-Up site discourage you from attending.  Long-time SPG members don't sign up -- they just show up.

Learn more at http://www.spgtennis.org/.

Please be sure to observe the following rules every time you walk onto a SPG tennis court.

•  Anytime that you cross a court or open a gate please stop and look first. Make sure that play is stopped and that the server has finished BOTH serves first.

•  Keep the noise level to a minimum so that you do not disturb the other courts. 

•  If your ball rolls on another court and could cause an injury to a player, please yell out "LET"...

•  If a ball is out, please call out, point out, or raise your racket to indicate the point is over and the ball was out.

•  At the end of each play-date, please pick up any loose balls, bottles, cans, etc and dispose of them. We want to remain a favorable customer to Wardlaw.

•  SPG has specific rules for when players are waiting. These rules are on the website listed under guidelines. Please familiarize yourselves with the rules. The waiting players need to be players ready and eager to play.
results.name: SPG Tennis - Central NJ Meet-Up Group

results.description:
Open to All Actors

This group is for actors of all levels who would like to gain more comfort, confidence and skill on stage. The meet-ups will give the actor the opportunity to learn and practice their craft in a safe, supportive and non-competitive atmosphere.

This is especially for actors who are feeling stuck, intimidated or insecure and who are tired of feeling like they constantly have to prove themselves. If you want to experience the joy of creative exploration while building your performance skills, this is the group for you.

About the Workshops

Improv techniques will be used to to help the actor become more spontaneous and to expand their verbal, emotional and physical expression. Many actors who learn improv techniques report feeling more comfortable on stage, less nervous on auditions, and greater ease when creating characters.

Each meet-up will focus on a different aspect of acting: e.g. character creation, emotional expression, relating to your scene partners, relationships, physicality, stage fright, enjoying yourself on stage, and more.

About Susan

The meet-ups will be lead by Susan Kaessinger, who has over 20 years of experience as a teacher, performer, director and coach and is currently a faculty member of The Lucy Moses School. Check out this interview with her in the online magazine Salted Scarletry: Spotlight: Susan Kaessinger.

Susan performs regularly with her improv group, MIshmash! at The Creek and The Cave theater in Long Island City where she won the 2013 Creek Award for Best Improv. Her blog was nominated for an INNY award from Improvisation News in 2012.

Pay What You Can - Suggested Donation $15

A donation of $15 is requested, however, if you cannot pay $15, just pay what you can. And, of course, if you would like to contribute more than $15, it is very much appreciated. Most improv classes in New York City cost an average of $35-50 per class session.

One of Susan's goals in creating this meetup group is to offer the opportunity to learn improv from an experienced teacher to a diverse group of people, regardless of whether or not they can afford the expensive classes offered at many schools.
results.name: Improv for Actors - Workshops in Park Slope, Brooklyn

topics.name: Learning to be a Professional Photographer

results.description:
This Fashion Photography Channel - Photo/Video Workshops group is for those involved in fashion industry - photographers, filmmakers, makeup artists, designers, stylists. We will organize networking events in NYC and Worldwide that are designed to help up and coming artists turn their talent into money.
We give you the tools to achieve your personal vision through photography (or video) and the guidance to turn your passion in to profession!

Our Short-Term Workshops ( from 1 day/3hrs -> 7 days ) are designed both for students beginning their education in Photography and for those interested in augmenting skills to advance their carriers.

We welcome any Photographers/Filmmakers who is willing to contribute to this Meetup's success. We always enjoy a mix of amateur and experienced shooters at all of our events which always provides for great discussions and learning opportunities for all.

Makeup artists/Hair Stylist/Wardrobe Designers/Stylists are also welcomed to join our group.
Your services are always needed and this group provides a tremendous networking opportunity.
For Models we have another (mirror) group at Facebook : (join here for free)

With over 50 successful workshops in past 2 years (check photos from each Workshop and group members reviews here at Meetup)  We teach how to shoot backstage beauty and provide one-on-one extensive Runway Fashion shoots training in NY, Milan, Paris, Moscow, Miami and LA.

Our crew flying or driving to various  exotic locations, working with best fashion photographers and publications in the world and can offer something UNIQUE, other groups and photo schools CAN'T...


We will always maintain a controlled shooting environment so that every photographer is guaranteed quality shooting time in the rotation. No "gang-bangs" paparazzi style or shoot-outs here.

We will always provide a friendly and fun atmosphere for everyone to shoot, network and learn new techniques.
Our Meetup group is designed to allow photographers to share in the cost of bringing in top modeling talent so that they can improve their skills in a comfortable environment.

Photographers may be required to pay an affordable fee to participate at our workshops, so that the group organizers can cover overhead expenses such as Model Scouting/transportation, Hair/Makeup kit fee compensation, wardrobe location scouting, additional lighting equipment, and instructors.

Please note:  After 30 days of free trial membership, this group has a a small $1.99 membership fee per month and will entitle members to bonuses such as: discounted event fees, bonus private sessions, preferential private shooting times, advance notice of upcoming events, extra shooting time.

IMPORTANT: Group Members who ACTIVELY participating at our events will be set to EXEMPT from membership fees ( available option at meetup website settings). Members who don't pay by attending events will be expected to pay dues to help support the models and success of our meetup or they will be removed from our group!

This is just a way to make sure that everyone here is really interested in participating

Your support is very much appreciated.

Your Member dues are used to:

• Cover Meetup costs for booking Models/Stylists
• Encourage more engaged members
• Have a reserve fund to pay our organizer's Meetup fees ($45/every 3 month)
• Provide supplies, props, fashion accessories or free trial of new photographic equipment at our   workshops (Just released Nikon Cameras and Lenses, triggers, strobes and more)
• Improve Meetups with detailed descriptions/location maps and photos, free tutorials, educational videos and more... ( time consuming process for us)
• Cover Equipment repairs, Flyers, Advertising, Travel Insurance, etc.

Cancel dues at any time.
Dues are billed each month.

Join our Meetup group TODAY, become a part of our Fashion Photography Channel community and send us your suggestions, dream location shoot ideas or any questions!

We look forward to seeing all of you again at the many amazing events we have planned for the months ahead!!!

Tatiana Naumova - Group Organizer

Anton Oparin ( PH Instructor) & stuff @ FashionStock.com team
results.name: Fashion Photography Channel - Photo/Video Workshops

topics.name: Environment, Green, Kids, Parents, Moms, Dads

results.description:
Check out our website HERE to see what we're all about:
http://greenfestivals.org/green-festival/about

Green Festival® Facts:

•    Green Festival® is the largest sustainability event in the world and continues to grow year after year.
•    Green Festival® is the only green event that screens exhibitors for their commitment to sustainability, ecological balance and social justice using Green America's green business standards.
•    Green Festival® walks its talk: each year it gets closer to being a zero-waste event.

About Green Festival

At Green Festival®, a project in cooperation with Green America and Global Exchange, we're celebrating what's working in our communities and around the world - for people, business and the environment.

Think of Green Festival® as a walk through a sustainable community. It begins with finding solutions to help make our lives healthier-socially, economically and environmentally. Individuals, business and community leaders come together to discuss critical issues that impact us at home and abroad. Organizations and businesses showcase programs and products that restore the planet and all that inhabit it. Neighbor-to-neighbor connections are formed and skills are shared to empower people to create positive change in the world.
results.name: New York Green Festival Team

results.description:
If you’re anything like me, life is moving fast – and you need new friends to ride along. In this group, forming friendships is more important than finding event partners. We kill the awkwardness of meeting strangers by keeping all activities small and personal. All events will have 12 or less attendees, with the exception of parties, picnics, and potlucks. Bottom line: Awkward Meetups with 62 random other members just won't cut it.

I was born in the late eighties. I limited this group to women born 1982-1992 so we could always be in a similar life stage. But that's where the exclusiveness ends. We’re open-minded and inclusive. Our industries are diverse – from fashion to finance, media to medicine, pharmaceuticals to photography, entertainment to engineering. Our zip codes range from the East Village to East Harlem, Soho to Sunset Park, Williamsburg to Woodlawn, Crown Heights to Chelsea, Astoria to Annadale. Our activities range from food to fitness, brunches to beer, museums to movies, clubbing to crafts.

We have a strict no-flake/unsure policy:

    Members must visit the event page within four months to stay in the group.

    RSVPs open 10 days in advance, so check back later to reserve your spot. For example, you can RSVP for a June 21st brunch starting the evening on June 11th.

    Always leave your phone number when you RSVP for an event – I send text messages for day-of updates. RSVPs without phone numbers are instantly deleted.

    Update your RSVP by the deadline if you can’t make it! Our events have a smaller headcount than most, so attendance does matter.

    Things happen at the last minute, and that’s okay! Just let me know. If you must cancel your attendance after the RSVP deadline, leave a message or be counted as a no-show. I will remove no-shows from the group on a regular basis.

    If you’re on the waitlist: 1) check the page often for last-minute spots – something almost always opens up! 2) PM me your phone number with the event title on the subject line. I’ll text you if a spot opens up!

    Event suggestions and ideas are ALWAYS encouraged. Just go directly on the group page to add a specific place, date, and time
results.name: Millennial Girlfriends of NYC (Born 1982-1992)

results.description: This group is for adults with diagnosed and self-diagnosed Asperger Syndrome who want to expand their social circle and have fun doing that. The purpose of the group is to engage, as a group of Aspies, in different types of activities geared to our interests. Our activities can be, for example; going fishing, bike riding, attending a conference or a science fair, going to a museum, watching a movie, meeting at a book store or library, almost anything that the members are interesting in. We will try to meet once a month to socialize and have fun. Who can join: Any Aspie that is proud of his uniqueness and sees Asperger as a gift, not a death sentence and wants to enjoy life and celebrate the gift of Asperger. Who should not join: Any self-pitiful, negative, or whining people.

results.description:

Our Chapter welcomes anyone who wants to join us in preserving our Freedoms, supporting the Constitution and saving our Republic.

While most analytic professionals feel this way, it can be hard to "practice what we preach." This group's mission is to help "democratize analytics" by bringing together people, ideas, and projects that help unlock more social benefit for more human beings.

results.description:
Looking for a place to connect with other art-types who speak your language? Join fellow NJ art directors, designers, photographers and illustrators for Artmeet. Whether you’re a freelancer that needs to escape their bubble or a staffer looking for a change of scenery, this is the place. Artmeet features workshops, idea swaps and a general exchange of knowledge—all within a casual, creatively supportive, and relaxed atmosphere. Let’s talk fonts and design strategy, teach each other techniques or just get ourselves off the computer for an hour and finger paint! We'll meet once a month, stretch and strengthen our creative muscles, and have some fun.

Artmeet is spreading! It started in Morris County, and has now come to Bergen County. As we grow we hope to keep expanding to other counties in NJ.

Artmeet is presented by the The Art Directors Club of New Jersey, but you don’t have to be a member to join us. Just in case you’ve never heard of ADCNJ, we’re a statewide, non-profit organization of art directors, graphic designers, illustrators, photographers, art educators, and other creative professionals whose talent and services contribute to excellence in the design and production of advertising, promotion, and publishing. Founded in 1961, the ADCNJ provides an opportunity for stimulating ideas, discovering new talents, sources, techniques, and a forum for the promotion and advancement of the professional designer and artist.
results.name: Artmeet (Bergen County): Art Directors Club of New Jersey

results.description: Since its founding in 1929, the Raritan Photographic Society has been serving the photographic interests of the community. The camera club is conducting an outstanding program of lectures, competitions, and special events. From September to May the club meets twice a month on Thursday evenings at locations in Milltown, NJ. At one meeting we feature member competitions in black-and-white prints, color prints and digital images, at the beginner, advanced and salon levels. Our second monthly meeting consists of lectures, demonstrations, discussions, or activities, such as a studio night. These programs are designed to help the members learn the basics of photography, new techniques for taking pictures, or applications of photography. We also organize field trips to photogenic sites, and a year-end banquet and competition. There are many benefits to joining RPS, such as the right to enter competitions, attend field trips and becoming better photographers. You are cordially invited to come to any of our meetings without becoming a member. However, in order to enter images into our competitions, you must be a dues-paying member. Please note that joining this Meetup group is not the same as becoming a dues-paying member of our photography club.
results.name: Raritan Photographic Society

results.description: When I lost my wife to cancer in Summer 2011, everything as I knew it stopped. I struggled mightily to find my way on my own, doing OK in some areas, but not OK in many others. Then I found a group of people in the same situation; with a recent loss. We formed what I hope are lifelong bonds and friendships. I have learned something about healing and moving forward from each and every one of them, and they have never let me fall into despair. This group is for young widows and widowers (under 45) to meet and find strength through each other, and is a continuation of the Manhattan Young Widows & Widowers Group.

topics.name: Joy Love Peace Harmony and Laughter
Bringing smiles happiness and joy to others!

results.description: Gather with a warm group of people to share positive messages of happiness, love, acceptance, and togetherness within public spaces. Its amazing how something so simple can be so profound. You'll be amazed at how people passing by, total strangers, respond and interact very positively with the messages. People pose for photos, stop for a chat to ask what we're about, or just give a warm smile or laugh while passing by. Messages are hand painted/drawn onto signs made by each individual or small group and generally include messages like, "You're beautiful!" "I love it when you smile." "Follow your love, follow your dreams." "Free hugs." "You are love." You get the point. We'll meet in different locations around the city where there's a considerable amount of space and foot traffic. We'll meet and share a moment of silence or meditation before and after the event to open and close. We'll start with around hour long meetups. Hindu, Christian, Atheist, Buddhist, Jewish, Muslim, people from all religious faiths and from no religion are welcome to gather in community to share these secular positive messages. It's a really nice way of meeting other like minded positive people around the city and I guarantee it will leave you feeling happier and more connected. Artists, street performers, musicians, bankers, yogis, lawyers, burners, Moms, Dads, Kids are welcome to creatively explore with us ways to co-create positive vibes and smiles at these events.
results.name: Public Displays of Affirmation (PDA) NYC

results.description: Are you up for a fun night out in meeting beautiful women? Come and have a blast at these women events & parties!! You are sure to meet other beautiful women for fun, relationships, friendships, partners, love, business, and much more!! Be free, be you and taking the first step is the way to go! Meet other singles like you who are looking for the same thing but yet hard to find.. LOVE. Dream more, do what makes you happy, take the path your heart desires, live for today and hope for tomorrow!! Hope to see you at my events but remember to bring only one thing and you're guaranteed a good time: Your Smile!!
results.name: NYC Lesbian Speeddaters

results.description: Whether strolling through Paris or zip-lining through the Costan Rican canopy... traveling is more fun with friends!
